revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 15:42:30.000000000', 'message': 'Remove IronicHostManager and baremetal scheduling options

The use_baremetal_filters and baremetal_enabled_filters were
deprecated in Pike: I843353427c90142a366ae9ca63ee4298b4f3ecd4

The IronicHostManager was deprecated in Queens:
Iebc74a09990dcda8cf0ee2a41f9ae1058d2a182a

Note that the NUMATopologyFilter should be OK in a mixed
VM/BM deployment because ironic compute nodes will not
report 'numa_topology' so those "hosts" will be filtered
out from requests for a specific NUMA topology or CPU
policy.

This change drops the deprecated baremetal scheduling options
and since the IronicHostManager is really only useful when
using those scheduling options, it is also removed.

Baremetal scheduling is now required to go through resource
classes.

Change-Id: I695b250c82c8dcedcd8e2bee00c56bb2df19212c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove IronicHostManager and baremetal scheduling options

The use_baremetal_filters and baremetal_enabled_filters were
deprecated in Pike: I843353427c90142a366ae9ca63ee4298b4f3ecd4

The IronicHostManager was deprecated in Queens:
Iebc74a09990dcda8cf0ee2a41f9ae1058d2a182a

Note that the NUMATopologyFilter should be OK in a mixed
VM/BM deployment because ironic compute nodes will not
report 'numa_topology' so those "hosts" will be filtered
out from requests for a specific NUMA topology or CPU
policy.

This change drops the deprecated baremetal scheduling options
and since the IronicHostManager is really only useful when
using those scheduling options, it is also removed.

Baremetal scheduling is now required to go through resource
classes.

Change-Id: I695b250c82c8dcedcd8e2bee00c56bb2df19212c

commit_message:
Source overcloudrc.v3 instead of overcloudrc

If we use the overcloud pingtest in queens
the keystone API will not work correctly as
/v2.0/tokens is not supported anymore.

This change will make we start using the new
URL endpoints.

Change-Id: Ic8899d5b2ac0588b2b4c230c058e13ddd75616b0

commit_message:
Source overcloudrc.v3 instead of overcloudrc

If we use the overcloud pingtest
in queens the keystone API will not work
correctly as /v2.0/tokens is not supported
anymore.

This change will make we start using the
new URL endpoints.

Change-Id: Id5e73d38fc3833a131b068cf60938370788b3257

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-12-27 10:32:23.000000000', 'message': 'Enable the HA deployment by default

With the HA NG work having landed, the impact of pacemaker
is reduced and only very few core services are being managed
by pacemaker. Since the HA deployments work just fine
with a single node, it makes little sense to use the non-ha
deployment as default any longer (Also because downstream
we do the default to the HA deployment by default and this
keeps confusing users)

This is the related CI change and we basically now remove -e
puppet-pacemaker.yaml as it is the default and explicitely
set -e nonha-arch.yaml for the non-ha jobs.

Change-Id: I5ff78b0b02b952bfba3c3bc512ffa77da3227b78

commit_message:
Enable the HA deployment by default

With the HA NG work having landed, the impact of pacemaker
is reduced and only very few core services are being managed
by pacemaker. Since the HA deployments work just fine
with a single node, it makes little sense to use the non-ha
deployment as default any longer (Also because downstream
we do the default to the HA deployment by default and this
keeps confusing users)

This is the related CI change and we basically now remove -e
puppet-pacemaker.yaml as it is the default and explicitely
set -e nonha-arch.yaml for the non-ha jobs.

Depends-On: I3a486d22b30ffdb6053b3d917dea373c1361df81
Change-Id: I5ff78b0b02b952bfba3c3bc512ffa77da3227b78

messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2017-11-06 18:41:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2017-11-06 20:41:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2017-11-06 20:46:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1 Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-05-09 06:55:58.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-06 18:41:49.000000000', 'message': "Use --config when we manipulate the CIB

Not using --config can potentially trigger reprobes and generally
make things slower. Let's use only --config which only pushes the
CIB portion related to the resources themselves and not their (or
the cluster's state).

Change-Id: Id6d671c5db95c33c98848731e2c412d952bff65c
"}, {'created': '2017-11-06 20:41:16.000000000', 'message': "Use --config when we manipulate the CIB

Not using --config can potentially trigger reprobes and generally
make things slower. Let's add --config during a push.
I will only push the CIB portion related to the resources themselves
and not their (or the cluster's) state.

Change-Id: Id6d671c5db95c33c98848731e2c412d952bff65c
"}]
commit_message:
Use --config when we manipulate the CIB

Not using --config can potentially trigger reprobes and generally
make things slower. Let's add --config during a push.
I will only push the CIB portion related to the resources themselves
and not their (or the cluster's) state.

Change-Id: Id6d671c5db95c33c98848731e2c412d952bff65c

subject: WIP Precreate /var/log/pacemaker/bundles
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-14 06:52:13.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Precreate /var/log/pacemaker/bundles

Until the following BZ hits Centos/RHEL we are better off creating the folders
ourselves so that the system_u:object_r:var_log_t:s0 context is used on the folder
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1508360. Once this BZ has been released
we can remove this directory creation code.

Without this fix selinux will block the logging of the HA containers.

Change-Id: Ia74683a4c3e61a4388f15da48ba567258979a740
'}]
commit_message:
WIP Precreate /var/log/pacemaker/bundles

Until the following BZ hits Centos/RHEL we are better off creating the folders
ourselves so that the system_u:object_r:var_log_t:s0 context is used on the folder
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1508360. Once this BZ has been released
we can remove this directory creation code.

Without this fix selinux will block the logging of the HA containers.

Change-Id: Ia74683a4c3e61a4388f15da48ba567258979a740

subject: WIP DNR Add /usr bind mount to pacemaker init_bundles
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-18 09:12:55.000000000', 'message': "WIP DNR Add /usr bind mount to pacemaker init_bundles

The reason for this is that when we will update to a newer pacemaker
version (for example during a RHEL minor update) there will be a new
xml schema on the host for pacemaker.

Currently we run pcs commands inside a container we potentially run
commands with an old pcs and old pacemaker libs/commands. If on the
host we have a newer pacemaker version we can get the following errors:
Error: unable to get crm_config
cibadmin: Connection to local file '/var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20171217-6-uhtnl3' failed:
Update does not conform to the configured schema Signon to CIB failed:
Update does not conform to the configured schema Init failed, could not perform requested operations
Error: pcs -f /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20171217-6-tzbv3f create failed: Error: unable to get cib
Error: /Stage[main]/Pacemaker::Stonith/Pacemaker::Property[Disable STONITH]/Pcmk_property[property--stonith-enabled]/ensure: change from absent to present failed: pcs -f /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20171217-6-tzbv3f create failed: Error: unable to get cib

Change-Id: I0df2cf563985e3fdfc00146a42caf18db3456acd

commit_message:
WIP DNR Add /usr bind mount to pacemaker init_bundles

The reason for this is that when we will update to a newer pacemaker
version (for example during a RHEL minor update) there will be a new
xml schema on the host for pacemaker.

Currently we run pcs commands inside a container we potentially run
commands with an old pcs and old pacemaker libs/commands. If on the
host we have a newer pacemaker version we can get the following errors:
Error: unable to get crm_config
cibadmin: Connection to local file '/var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20171217-6-uhtnl3' failed:
Update does not conform to the configured schema Signon to CIB failed:
Update does not conform to the configured schema Init failed, could not perform requested operations
Error: pcs -f /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20171217-6-tzbv3f create failed: Error: unable to get cib
Error: /Stage[main]/Pacemaker::Stonith/Pacemaker::Property[Disable STONITH]/Pcmk_property[property--stonith-enabled]/ensure: change from absent to present failed: pcs -f /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20171217-6-tzbv3f create failed: Error: unable to get cib

Change-Id: I0df2cf563985e3fdfc00146a42caf18db3456acd
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Disable libvirtd on the undercloud

Sometimes libvirtd can race with the iptables service when setting upthe
iptables rules. The iptables service will fail with:

    ERROR: problem running iptables: Another app is currently holding the xtables lock. Perhaps you want to use the -w option?

We do not need libvirtd on the undercloud in any case so add it to the
disabled services.

Change-Id: I28f50b73e89fd89f34d181d950fa8ddab57fa61c

commit_message:
Refactor watcher API for Action Plan Start

Currently the REST API to start action plan in watcher
is which is same as for update action plan.

PATCH /v1/action_plans

https://docs.openstack.org/watcher/latest/api/v1.html

we need to make it easy to understand like :

POST /v1/action_plans/{action_plan_uuid}/start

the action should be start in above case.
Change-Id: I5353e4aa58d1675d8afb94bea35d9b953514129a
Closes-Bug: #1756274

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-29 04:07:50.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "rabbit: Don't prefetch when batch_size is set"

This reverts commit c881baed29db49c5710795496cb07907e35ceaba.

Eventhough batch_size is set, rabbitMQ prefetch count is not changed
at the first time of connection creation. It works only connection reset
cases(i.e. rabbitMQ restart). So this patch can not fix original issue
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1551667

Moreover, it makes another bug that messages of sameple queues are not
consumed properly. So revert it.

Change-Id: Ia8ebee8e2a670e46b6a68859bc30e717bd56ed7e

Closes-bug: 1759755

commit_message:
Revert "rabbit: Don't prefetch when batch_size is set"

This reverts commit c881baed29db49c5710795496cb07907e35ceaba.

Eventhough batch_size is set, rabbitMQ prefetch count is not changed
at the first time of connection creation. It works only connection reset
cases(i.e. rabbitMQ restart). So this patch can not fix original issue
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1551667

Moreover, it makes another bug that messages of sameple queues are not
consumed properly. So revert it.

Change-Id: Ia8ebee8e2a670e46b6a68859bc30e717bd56ed7e
Signed-off-by: Wonil Choi <wonil22.choi@samsung.com>
Closes-bug: 1759755

commit_message:
Use clean keystone URL in the keystone validation

Inventory variable overcloud_keystone_url gets its
value from stack's output 'KeystoneURL'
which might include the keystone version.
We need to get rid off the version, otherwise
undercloud validations fail at the time of
checking the Keystone endpoint [0].

[0] - https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-validations/blob/545e4924e30769eb06100be1b5b2cd64637cf76e/validations/openstack-endpoints.yaml#L28

Co-Authored-By: Jose Luis Franco <jfrancoa@redhat.com>
Story: #2001897

Change-Id: I3e900afd840a4a0504a573a1eabe80911f8f7881

Hi Infra cores,

I am Tung Doan, an OpenStack developer. Previously, I am an active member of OpenStack Tacker which focuses on NFV Orchestrator. For our proposed project Apmec, we already had code locally. It requires api-server, horizon, and client as mentioned in this patch.

Please help approve this patch. Thanks'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-13 14:15:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

You said you had existing code: You can import an existing repository including it's history if you have one. Once the repository is created, importing is not possible anymore, changes will have to go through the normal review process.

If you have a lot of history to import, please use the upstream field
instead of creating a repository and then pushing the patches one at a
time. Pushing a large number of related patches all at one time causes
the CI infrastructure to slow down, which impacts work on all of the
other projects using it. After repo creation the infra team will not
push any content to it; this is your only chance to import directly.

Please confirm that starting with empty repo is fine."}, {'account_id': 20560, 'date': '2017-12-13 14:37:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Hi Ardreas, :)

It is a very nice suggestion. I will consider your point and then I will be back to update the patch soon. architecture [1] in order to aim at providing the lifecycle
management of MEC applications.

commit_message:
Add Apmec project to OpenStack (Part 1)

Apmec stands for an Automated Platform for Multi-access computing,
which is OpenStack based MEC Orchestration framework.
Apmec is the first open-source project that is motivated by ETSI MEC
framework and reference architecture [1] in order to aim at
providing the lifecycle management of MEC applications.

[1] http://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_gs/MEC/001_099/003/01.01.01_60/gs_MEC003v010101p.pdf

Change-Id: I47e0654ebc9d64ec426b5cf69a60b1ad38ddc42a
Signed-off-by: Tung Doan <tung.doan_van@tu-dresden.de>

commit_message:
WIP Fix up fence_compute parameters

Seems upstream has renamed domain to compute-domain,
project_domain to project-domain and user_domain to user-domain.
The - vs _ might be a pcs bug.

This fixes things up. While I investigate wtf happened upstream
am starting this review as these things are rarely fixable quickly :/

Change-Id: I83379fb7642553b9d1ad2ebd53db67796e12ebd3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 12:33:15.000000000', 'message': "WIP DNR Do not restart the docker service on stack updates

Restarting the docker service seemingly has a number of negative
implications on an overcloud. When we added --live-restore to docker
we assumed that we were covered in most cases. The only left out
case was the 'upgrade the docker rpm' one, where we actually
stopped all containers, stopped docker, upgraded the packages
and then started docker again.

The problem with restarting docker (even with --live-restore) seems
to be that we actually get the daemon in a hanging state.
(see RHBZ#1566439 and the many deadlock mentions on github).

So let's prototype a way to actually *not* restart the docker service
when the overcloud is already up.

Let's consider four scenarios:
A) Initial deploy
This is untouched by the patch and works as before

B) Re-deploy against an existing overcloud
This is probably one of the most problematic ones, because the following
might happen.
B.1) A docker config change will trigger a docker service restart
B.2) The docker service restart will happen more or less at the same
time on all controller nodes.
B.3) Massive service desruption ensues and potentially pacemaker will
fail resources as well and can potentially fence nodes if stopping
a resource fails.

With this patch we'd avoid this situation by simply never restarting
docker.

C) Minor updates
Here if we detect a config change via puppet or a docker package upgrade
we do the following:
C.1) We stop all containers and then docker
C.2) We update the package
C.3) We rerun puppet
C.4) We start docker

With this patch we need to make sure that we do not rely on puppet to
start the service but we need to do it via ansible in the update
task.

D) Major upgrades
We'd avoid to restart docker completely

Change-Id: I75a0e200b96cc5057c95d7f892eb9f23bb97a042
"}, {'created': '2018-04-17 15:19:59.000000000', 'message': "WIP DNR Do not restart the docker service on stack updates

Restarting the docker service seemingly has a number of negative
implications on an overcloud. When we added --live-restore to docker
we assumed that we were covered in most cases. The only left out
case was the 'upgrade the docker rpm' one, where we actually
stopped all containers, stopped docker, upgraded the packages
and then started docker again (this was done with the minor updates
task)

The problem with restarting docker (apparently only with the
--live-restore) seems to be that we actually get the daemon in a hanging
state (see RHBZ#1566439 and the many deadlock mentions on github).

So let's prototype a way to actually *not* restart the docker service
when a configuration change happens.

Let's consider four scenarios:
A) Initial deploy
This is untouched by the patch and works as before

B) Re-deploy against an existing overcloud
This is probably one of the most problematic ones, because the following
might happen.
B.1) A docker config change will trigger a docker service restart
B.2) The docker service restart will happen more or less at the same
time on all controller nodes.
B.3) Massive service desruption ensues and potentially pacemaker will
fail resources as well and can potentially fence nodes if stopping
a resource fails.

With this patch we'd avoid this situation by simply never restarting
docker (it can still be restarted via a minor update workflow)

C) Minor updates
Here if we detect a config change via puppet or a docker package upgrade
we do the following:
C.1) We stop all containers and then docker
C.2) We update the package
C.3) We rerun puppet
C.4) We start docker

With this patch we need to make sure that we do not rely on puppet to
start the service but we need to do it via ansible in the update
task.

D) Major upgrades
We would not restart docker. It would be restarted (if needed) via a
minor update (either the one before the major upgrade, or one
afterwards)

Change-Id: I75a0e200b96cc5057c95d7f892eb9f23bb97a042
"}]
commit_message:
WIP DNR Do not restart the docker service on stack updates

Restarting the docker service seemingly has a number of negative
implications on an overcloud. When we added --live-restore to docker
we assumed that we were covered in most cases. The only left out
case was the 'upgrade the docker rpm' one, where we actually
stopped all containers, stopped docker, upgraded the packages
and then started docker again (this was done with the minor updates
task)

The problem with restarting docker (apparently only with the
--live-restore) seems to be that we actually get the daemon in a hanging
state (see RHBZ#1566439 and the many deadlock mentions on github).

So let's prototype a way to actually *not* restart the docker service
when a configuration change happens.

Let's consider four scenarios:
A) Initial deploy
This is untouched by the patch and works as before

B) Re-deploy against an existing overcloud
This is probably one of the most problematic ones, because the following
might happen.
B.1) A docker config change will trigger a docker service restart
B.2) The docker service restart will happen more or less at the same
time on all controller nodes.
B.3) Massive service desruption ensues and potentially pacemaker will
fail resources as well and can potentially fence nodes if stopping
a resource fails.

With this patch we'd avoid this situation by simply never restarting
docker (it can still be restarted via a minor update workflow)

C) Minor updates
Here if we detect a config change via puppet or a docker package upgrade
we do the following:
C.1) We stop all containers and then docker
C.2) We update the package
C.3) We rerun puppet
C.4) We start docker

With this patch we need to make sure that we do not rely on puppet to
start the service but we need to do it via ansible in the update
task.

D) Major upgrades
We would not restart docker. It would be restarted (if needed) via a
minor update (either the one before the major upgrade, or one
afterwards)

Change-Id: I75a0e200b96cc5057c95d7f892eb9f23bb97a042

commit_message:
Do not assume OS release

The ceilometer charm was assuming grizzly before the ceilometer-common
package was installed to determine the OS release. On queens deploys
this breaks due packages not being installed.

If ceilomter-common is not installed return empty configs.

Change-Id: Ib8bc1b7be3595bd8e64a25d0444dd768b80de881
Closes-Bug: #1759301

commit_message:
Convert fping API to processutils.execute()

Now that we don't have any calls to execute things as root,
it makes sense to move to just calling processutils.execute()
directly instead of going through our own redirection layer
which doesn't really do much.

Convert fping to call processutils directly.

Change-Id: I70a2646f2aa700ac796e0db3f79c41ca518162ea
blueprint: execs-ive-had-a-few

commit_message:
Use .. deprecated:: theme for deprecations

We were using `warning`, and `important` themes to mark deprecations in
various places.  We have a `deprecated` role, so this change switches to
use it.

Note that I also found the following files that mentioned deprecation,
but not in a way where using this role seemed appropriate.  I'm
recording them here so you know I considered them.

doc/source/admin/configuration/hypervisor-kvm.rst
doc/source/admin/configuration/schedulers.rst
doc/source/cli/index.rst
doc/source/cli/nova-rootwrap.rst
doc/source/contributor/api.rst
doc/source/contributor/code-review.rst
doc/source/contributor/policies.rst
doc/source/contributor/project-scope.rst
doc/source/reference/policy-enforcement.rst
doc/source/reference/stable-api.rst
doc/source/user/feature-classification.rst
doc/source/user/flavors.rst
doc/source/user/upgrade.rst

Change-Id: Icd7613d9886cfe0775372c817e5f3d07d8fb553d

commit_message:
Allow configuration of NFS backend for Nova

Allow NFS configuration of storage backend for Nova.
This way the instances files will be stored on a shared
NFS storage.

Implements: bp tripleo-nova-nfs

Change-Id: I4ce73bbf4158c51effc9828031f7b51303d9b89f
Depends-On: Id15aec6324814a871e87f19f24999b0e3b8a8f05

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-17499 : SUCCESS in 1h 01m 00s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-28 04:58:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/564964/2/ : SUCCESS in 2h 12m 47s'}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2018-04-28 06:14:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8745, 'date': '2018-04-28 13:48:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-28 15:29:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I agree with this change.  It sounds like we're *not* cleaning up these particular allocations on the possibility that the migration target was an ocata host, which will clean them up itself.  If that's the case, the allocation (and therefore the warning) will disappear after a little while.  If it's not the case, it's acceptable for this warning to appear every _update_available_resource period, because the allocations *won't* disappear automatically, and that requires actual operator intervention.

We could start looking at better solutions where e.g. we don't start logging the warning until we've seen this allocation hanging around for "a while".  But then we get into needing to keep track of such allocations between periods, etc., and it's just not worth all that.

I suppose we could enhance the log message to indicate that the allocation may get cleaned up automatically, and no action is required unless you keep seeing it.  But meh.

Not sure why zuul didn't run here, but you're going to fail pep as Kevin pointed out.  Otherwise I'm +2.'}, {'account_id': 8745, 'date': '2018-04-28 20:30:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8745, 'date': '2018-04-28 20:32:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-04-28 21:21:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-17519 : SUCCESS in 48m 33s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-28 22:03:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-28 22:46:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Build succeeded.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/564964/4/ : SUCCESS in 2h 12m 52s'}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2018-05-02 02:05:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-08 22:28:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(2 comments)

I'm OK with this, but don't really think we should be hitting it anymore. The bug was reported against Pike (not sure if the compute node logging it was pike or ocata though), but I know we fixed a lot of allocation cleanup stuff post pike-GA so likely people were hitting this with pike GA and we've hopefully shored up those problems now. Given that, we shouldn't hit this, so if we do, yeah WARNING is better to indicate something is wrong and we need to fix it."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-09 00:41:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck cellsv1 rebuild race'}]

commit_message:
log stale allocations as WARNING instead of DEBUG

Stale resource allocations can prevent Nova from scheduling new
instances on a host that otherwise has sufficient resources available.
Nova would log a message about this situation on the affected compute
node, but it was logged at DEBUG priority and so would typically not
be visible in a production environment.

This commit modifies Nova to log the message as a warning instead.

Change-Id: I347d2ab0077c4d9b62bc169af9e039d00ec214fa
Closes-bug: #1767553

commit_message:
Fix periodic job

There was a version mismath beween python libraries installed
by apt and the ones by pip. So use a virtual environment to
install DIB.

Change-Id: Ia00a79b5dbc61947e1f37c11de9a7f3bb9dddd8a

commit_message:
Log useful information in the API log

heat-api doesn't routinely log anything above DEBUG level, and then most of
the information comes from random middleware like version_negotiation. Log
the actual request at INFO level, and remove useless information like the
address in memory of the Controller object from the debug logs.

Change-Id: I5bb115abd31b4050e608e913058b6955b4bddc5a

'}, {'created': '2018-05-04 11:39:45.000000000', 'message': "Monitor phys_bridges to reconfigured it if created again

In case when external bridge configured in OVS agent's bridge_mappings
will be destroyed and created again (for example by running ifup-ovs
script on Centos) bride wasn't configured by OVS agent.
That might cause broken connectivity for OpenStack's dataplane if
dataplane network also uses same bridge.

This patch adds additional ovsdb-monitor to monitor if any
of physical bridges configured in bridge_mappings was created.
If so, agent will reconfigure it to restore proper openflow rules
on it.

Change-Id: I9c0dc587e70327e03be5a64522d0c679665f79bd
Closes-Bug: #1768990

commit_message:
Monitor phys_bridges to reconfigured it if created again

In case when external bridge configured in OVS agent's bridge_mappings
will be destroyed and created again (for example by running ifup-ovs
script on Centos) bridge wasn't configured by OVS agent.
That might cause broken connectivity for OpenStack's dataplane if
dataplane network also uses same bridge.

This patch adds additional ovsdb-monitor to monitor if any
of physical bridges configured in bridge_mappings was created.
If so, agent will reconfigure it to restore proper openflow rules
on it.

Change-Id: I9c0dc587e70327e03be5a64522d0c679665f79bd
Closes-Bug: #1768990

[{'created': '2018-04-04 07:42:30.000000000', 'message': '[WIP][L3][QoS] Cover mixed dvr_snat and compute node dvr router

The dvr_snat node can also run the nova-compute which will
make the fip_qos l3 agent failed to install the qos rules for
the router floating IPs tc rule.

For dvr router in snat node, we should process the floating
IP QoS again in qrouter-namesapce to cover the mixed deployment
with nova-compute scenario.

Once fip_qos l3 agent extension can get the fip-namespace
rfp-device, the tc rules will be set again on it.

Change-Id: I9eca25201e0647d4da77b325fba03cca1db5bb4d
Closes-Bug: #1758316

The dvr_snat node can also run the nova-compute which will
make the fip_qos l3 agent extension failed to install the
qos tc rules for the dvr router floating IPs.

To cover such mixed deployment, the tc rules for floating IP
qos will be processed again in qrouter-namesapce of the
dvr_snat node, and the device is rfp-device.

Change-Id: I9eca25201e0647d4da77b325fba03cca1db5bb4d
Closes-Bug: #1758316
'}, {'created': '2018-04-21 04:25:22.000000000', 'message': '[L3][QoS] Cover mixed dvr_snat and compute node dvr router

The dvr_snat node can also run the nova-compute which will
make the fip_qos l3 agent extension failed to install the

commit_message:
[L3][QoS] Cover mixed dvr_snat and compute node dvr router

The dvr_snat node can also run the nova-compute which will
make the fip_qos l3 agent extension failed to install the
qos tc rules for the dvr router floating IPs.

To cover such mixed deployment, the tc rules for floating IP
qos will be processed again in qrouter-namespace of the
dvr_snat node, and the device is rfp-device.

Change-Id: I9eca25201e0647d4da77b325fba03cca1db5bb4d
Closes-Bug: #1758316

commit_message:
[Optimize] Validate configured scheduler filters when initialize

The correctness of default scheduler filters will be validated
only when processing filter requests, this means administrators
will be unware of that until creating requests keep failing.
This patch moves that logic into initialization code.

Change-Id: I596c94fae33767b6b8d4816e572ff5e9dda621b7
(cherry picked from commit fe7b3812a67d378cbf89dfea241015c013aec4c0)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 13:18:17.000000000', 'message': 'Improve ChunkedBackupDriver hashlib calls

Currently we have 2 hashlib calls withing the ChunkedBackupDriver, one
to calculate the MD5 of the chunk and another to calculate the SHA256 of
the blocks within each chunk.

This patch improve interactions between cinder and the hashlib library
method calls by making sure MD5 and SHA256 related calls are execute in
a native thread to improve context switching responsiveness within
eventlet.

The MD5 of a 1GB chunk could take around 4 seconds, so the overhead of
creating a native thread is acceptable, and for the SHA256 instead of
creating a thread for each call we create a single thread to do the
calculations of all the blocks, thus making it cost effective.

Current code slices the data into blocks, which means that the data is being
copied, but this has now been switched to a memoryview object to take advantage
of the buffer protocol so copying of data is no longer necesary.

Change-Id: Ifb65b8008f30bc9cc4b6cd9b867a726ec4ed4707
(cherry picked from commit 671b02b504a45953cf225a210c361729d480dd66)
Conflicts:
	cinder/backup/chunkeddriver.py
(cherry picked from commit 2ec114d3c7306b431ab2bd2ee47bf09eb8223ffd)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve ChunkedBackupDriver hashlib calls

Currently we have 2 hashlib calls withing the ChunkedBackupDriver, one
to calculate the MD5 of the chunk and another to calculate the SHA256 of
the blocks within each chunk.

This patch improve interactions between cinder and the hashlib library
method calls by making sure MD5 and SHA256 related calls are execute in
a native thread to improve context switching responsiveness within
eventlet.

The MD5 of a 1GB chunk could take around 4 seconds, so the overhead of
creating a native thread is acceptable, and for the SHA256 instead of
creating a thread for each call we create a single thread to do the
calculations of all the blocks, thus making it cost effective.

Current code slices the data into blocks, which means that the data is being
copied, but this has now been switched to a memoryview object to take advantage
of the buffer protocol so copying of data is no longer necesary.

Change-Id: Ifb65b8008f30bc9cc4b6cd9b867a726ec4ed4707
(cherry picked from commit 671b02b504a45953cf225a210c361729d480dd66)
Conflicts:
	cinder/backup/chunkeddriver.py
(cherry picked from commit 2ec114d3c7306b431ab2bd2ee47bf09eb8223ffd)

A recent'ish change in openstack-manuals [1] noted the new support for

commit_message:
doc: Don't confuse CPU pinning/NUMA as Hyper-V only

A recent'ish change in openstack-manuals [1] noted the new support for
NUMA topologies when using the Hyper-V driver. As part of this change, a
section was added that describes the configuration steps that were
necessary on Hyper-V hosts before booting instances. However, the way
this section is integrated gives the impression that NUMA support is a
Hyper-V only feature.

Correct this by moving this configuration step to the end of the
document and instead opting to link to it from higher in the doc.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/424102/

Change-Id: Ic8d9c1b35d52a26374763b5c0e4be79875814569
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Cleaned up engine/scheduler and improved behavior

* Fixed batches sleeping prematurely.
* Fixed potential unwanted exception when shutting worker down.
* Cleaned up code.
* Removed dead code.

Change-Id: Ie31868f0125dcaf92521d9827cc214ddb5a66f64

0-255 supports all of them.

[{'created': '2018-05-08 09:00:59.000000000', 'message': "Nova: Don't set console server_proxyclient_address as null

This PS make server_proxyclient_address to use default values on other
pods except console-proxy pod and nova-compute pods.
Until Ocata version, null value was acceptable. But from Pike version,
occurs error.

Change-Id: I4ef4ed78f4ca0ee456c20b8bfd53956030388760
Closes-Bug: #1769842
"}]
commit_message:
Nova: Don't set console server_proxyclient_address as null

This PS make server_proxyclient_address to use default values on other
pods except console-proxy pod and nova-compute pods.
Until Ocata version, null value was acceptable. But from Pike version,
occurs error.

Change-Id: I4ef4ed78f4ca0ee456c20b8bfd53956030388760
Closes-Bug: #1769842

commit_message:
RBD: add support for active/active replication

This patch breaks failover_host into the two requisite parts (failover
and failover_completed) to support both single-backend and multiple
backends configured as active/active.

Change-Id: Ie59ba9ad538b2e607dd7ccabc0fbb035a6acf3b0

[{'created': '2018-04-26 20:22:17.000000000', 'message': 'RBD: Handle ImageNotFound exception in _get_usage_info correctly

Change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/486734 moved try-except
statement to the wrong place. We need to open image in Ceph inside
try-except block.

This patch also fixes race condition between volume deletion and
_get_usage_info calls.

Co-Authored-By: Melanie Witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closed-Bug: #1765845

 Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict was from the fact that test__get_usage_info
did not already exist in Ocata.

Change-Id: I7d3d006b023ca4b7963c4c684e4c036399d1295c
(cherry picked from commit 3cc8cbdee7c98e1fcf41bb27d81e34fef3a2d032)
(cherry picked from commit c935eb8305f21745480abb49e1e380f1c9053d9a)
(cherry picked from commit c9ede461d794d26b9bb647f04e4625d7ec3c2b28)
'}]
commit_message:
RBD: Handle ImageNotFound exception in _get_usage_info correctly

Change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/486734 moved try-except
statement to the wrong place. We need to open image in Ceph inside
try-except block.

This patch also fixes race condition between volume deletion and
_get_usage_info calls.

Co-Authored-By: Melanie Witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closed-Bug: #1765845

 Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict was from the fact that test__get_usage_info
did not already exist in Ocata.

Change-Id: I7d3d006b023ca4b7963c4c684e4c036399d1295c
(cherry picked from commit 3cc8cbdee7c98e1fcf41bb27d81e34fef3a2d032)
(cherry picked from commit c935eb8305f21745480abb49e1e380f1c9053d9a)
(cherry picked from commit c9ede461d794d26b9bb647f04e4625d7ec3c2b28)

[doc] Add the possible status for attachment

Add the possible status of the attachment, and also
make short description for each status.

Change-Id: Ieef1ea94acf69fa906b9f62f2081d66166ba9174

commit_message:
Collect resource id from RequestSpec parameter

Try to get resource id from RequestSpec parameter
instead of VolumeProperties, fix the incorrect
log output as below:

```
Exceeded max scheduling attempts 3 for volume None
```

Change-Id: Ib28539c7970f66b94fc2540d66d8cf5c3b7bfc6b
Closes-Bugs: #1765927

commit_message:
Parent of RBD cloned volume marked as deleted should not be manageable

Parent of RBD cloned volune which marked as deleted should not be
manageable. The API (get_manageable_volumes) of RBD driver needs to be fixed.

Change-Id: I4e314ac3003f528de72391d1376d70454206e12a

commit_message:
Fix bindep for multipath

Use the correct package for el7 distributions.

Fix the package name for Ubuntu as well.

Change-Id: Ice9d6fdab3fb0aca4ac630c4a32d9e1447461194

commit_message:
RBD snapshot needs to be protected/unprotected after being managed/unmanaged

The managed RBD snapshot needs to be protected, just as the same with
procedure of creating a new Cinder RBD snapshot, to prevent the snapshot
being deleted. When unmanage RBD snapshot, unprotect the snapshot when
it has no children.

Change-Id: Iff0a75369a603a348163cc4a2211bb6e6ad1fea9

(1 comment)

Can you elaborate why macvlan doesn't need to wait for port to become active in Neutron?"}, {'account_id': 27824, 'date': '2018-03-26 09:21:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-03-26 17:26:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25509, 'date': '2018-03-30 11:27:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Oh, thank you for your comment.

But, as I commented, I already tried to add a @property.
on, os_vif_util.py,

I fix to "active=k_vif.VIFMacvlanNested.active,"
then the tox error messages

AssertionError: Expected call: VIFMacvlanNested(active=True, address=sentinel.mac_address, has_traffic_filtering=sentinel.port_filter, id=sentinel.port_id, network=sentinel.network, plugin='noop', preserve_on_delete=False, vif_name=sentinel.vif_name)
    Actual call: VIFMacvlanNested(active=<MagicMock name='VIFMacvlanNested.active' id='113233744'>, address=sentinel.mac_address, has_traffic_filtering=sentinel.port_filter, id=sentinel.port_id, network=sentinel.network, plugin='noop', preserve_on_delete=False, vif_name=sentinel.vif_name)

How to get property valute from VIFMacvlanNested?

Typically, we can get property value after create object. right?
So, I create object like below,
" active=k_vif.VIFMacvlanNested().active,"
occur "AttributeError: '_SentinelObject' object has no attribute 'active'"'}, {'account_id': 25509, 'date': '2018-04-03 01:31:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

PTAL!'}, {'account_id': 25509, 'date': '2018-04-05 15:38:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

PTAL!'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-04-05 16:19:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry for not answering, there were Easter Holidays and I'm catching up with emails.

I've tried adding the property and it indeed doesn't work (passes unit tests, but isn't forcing `active` to be `True`).

Can you point out where the "unnecessary" waiting happens in the code? Because I think it should be implemented in a way that we're just skipping waiting for MacVLAN VIFs there.

Or we can do something like that in VIFMacvlanNested:

 __init__(self, active, **kwargs):
   super(VIFMacvlanNested, self).__init__(**kwargs)
   # Forcing `active` to be True, because it doesn't matter for Macvlan.
   self.active = True'}, {'account_id': 25509, 'date': '2018-04-06 06:28:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think the checking procedure for active port status for macvlan is not necessary.'}, {'account_id': 25509, 'date': '2018-04-06 06:57:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Actually, active status is always True, it does not need to additional function call.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-04-06 14:04:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ah, okay, so sorry for misunderstanding you. I thought waiting happens later in the workflow.

In case you just want to skip a single comparison, I don't think we ever need this patch. A single comparison isn't really anything that's affecting performance too much and we'll start getting weird issues if Neutron ever changes this behavior. Do you have any evidence of performance improvement this patch causes?

What do other folks think?"}, {'account_id': 25509, 'date': '2018-04-12 04:29:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

But, if return value is late from "_is_port_active()", kuryr-cni is waiting. 
The function call is single, even sometimes waiting time is so long.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-04-16 19:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> But, if return value is late from "_is_port_active()", kuryr-cni is
 > waiting.
 > The function call is single, even sometimes waiting time is so
 > long.

Sorry, I don't understand. You mean kuryr-cni is waiting here [1]?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/blob/89a8bd08b5f4ba3410d015ae0f71d10cf4f3b885/kuryr_kubernetes/cni/handlers.py#L81-L82'}, {'account_id': 21747, 'date': '2018-05-08 08:15:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't think there is any waiting when using macvlan nested driver.

In macvlan nested driver, the vif status doesn't wait for the Neutron port become active, it's just set immediately. Actually, the Neutron port will keep being "Down" in my environment when using macvlan nested deployment. 

```
    def activate_vif(self, pod, vif):
        # NOTE(mchiappe): there is no way to get feedback on the actual
        # interface creation or activation as no plugging can happen for this
        # interface type. However the status of the port is not relevant as
        # it is used for IPAM purposes only, thus just set 'active'
        # immediately to let the CNI driver make progress.
        vif.active = True
```'}, {'account_id': 25509, 'date': '2018-05-09 00:57:51.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 25509, 'date': '2018-05-09 00:59:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

close this commit'}]

commit_message:
remove unnecessary checking activated neutron port when using macvlan

Macvlan does not need to wait for activating neutron port.
It need only IP address and MAC address.
So, waiting for "_is_port_active()" is not needed.

"_is_port_active()" cause unnecessary waiting time.

Closes-Bug: 1758258

Change-Id: I586e208e5f5e472489b564590d7f6611d8254271
signed-off-by: jihoon <jihoon.o@samsung.com>

[{'created': '2018-05-07 12:16:46.000000000', 'message': 'Adding wrapper scripts for neutron agent subprocesses

The neutron agents use subprocesses like dnsmasq and keepalived as part
of their implementation. Running these "subprocesses" in separate
containers prevent dataplane breakages/unnecessary failover on agent
container restart.

Also amends docker daemon options to allow including additional unix
domain sockets to bind to the docker daemon. The paths can be mounted by
containers that launch containers instead of mounting /run/docker.sock.
This avoids issues if the docker daemon is restarted while the containers
are running.

Conflicts:
    manifests/profile/base/docker.pp

Related-Bug: #1749209
Change-Id: Icd4c24ac686d957391548a04722266cefc1bce27
(cherry picked from commit 015c9b757af33e7c2c07d932c45145e1c09ca733)
'}]
commit_message:
Adding wrapper scripts for neutron agent subprocesses

The neutron agents use subprocesses like dnsmasq and keepalived as part
of their implementation. Running these "subprocesses" in separate
containers prevent dataplane breakages/unnecessary failover on agent
container restart.

Also amends docker daemon options to allow including additional unix
domain sockets to bind to the docker daemon. The paths can be mounted by
containers that launch containers instead of mounting /run/docker.sock.
This avoids issues if the docker daemon is restarted while the containers
are running.

Conflicts:
    manifests/profile/base/docker.pp

Related-Bug: #1749209
Change-Id: Icd4c24ac686d957391548a04722266cefc1bce27
(cherry picked from commit 015c9b757af33e7c2c07d932c45145e1c09ca733)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-08 16:53:17.000000000', 'message': "Stop trying to converge during Ceph upgrade command

This had no effect as we only updated the plan and not the
stack. We'll do a normal converge after Ceph upgrade command, which
will also take care of putting back the normal deploy
CephAnsiblePlaybook.

Furthermore it was prepending the converge env file to a list of envs
which already had the *prepare* env file at a latter position (we
reused the env list from the prepare call :) ), so it kept doing
prepare operation instead of converge.

And perhaps most importantly, the messages printed to user are
misleading since no converge was really happening.

Also adds support for --container-registry-file to ceph-upgrade command,
while not necessary, some of the functions called by ceph-upgrade
command expect to receive the container-registry parameters.

Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I025eac40f8bda5f23c789e7fef1a9e9b49947f66
Partial-Bug: #1768586
(cherry picked from commit 1612b374d7b6969a06351de2bd43d04e8b5e4fb6)
"}]
commit_message:
Stop trying to converge during Ceph upgrade command

This had no effect as we only updated the plan and not the
stack. We'll do a normal converge after Ceph upgrade command, which
will also take care of putting back the normal deploy
CephAnsiblePlaybook.

Furthermore it was prepending the converge env file to a list of envs
which already had the *prepare* env file at a latter position (we
reused the env list from the prepare call :) ), so it kept doing
prepare operation instead of converge.

And perhaps most importantly, the messages printed to user are
misleading since no converge was really happening.

Also adds support for --container-registry-file to ceph-upgrade command,
while not necessary, some of the functions called by ceph-upgrade
command expect to receive the container-registry parameters.

Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I025eac40f8bda5f23c789e7fef1a9e9b49947f66
Partial-Bug: #1768586
(cherry picked from commit 1612b374d7b6969a06351de2bd43d04e8b5e4fb6)

[{'created': '2018-05-08 08:53:39.000000000', 'message': 'Verify undercloud installation in fs027.

The job tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-containers is
failing during undercloud installation but this is
not being caught up, as the flag to verify the undercloud
installation is set to false.

Change-Id: I1a10ce0b9088d90de3e22374a88d17ff4b2e252a
'}]
commit_message:
Verify undercloud installation in fs027.

The job tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-containers is
failing during undercloud installation but this is
not being caught up, as the flag to verify the undercloud
installation is set to false.

Change-Id: I1a10ce0b9088d90de3e22374a88d17ff4b2e252a

commit_message:
add tripleo update job as voting

    add an update voting job to mimimal check

    At the moment tripleo-upgrade is ungated.
    To properly protect against changes in tripleo
    repos it is useful to run the update job as
    voting to help detect if a tripleo change
    caused the update job to fail.

Related-Change: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565523/
Change-Id: Iecdaf0af05d8810738785d6e858b281aff9aba29

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-08 14:19:01.000000000', 'message': 'Alter collect heat templates dir from undercloud

output_dir defaults to $HOME in tripleoclient,
and the heat templates deployed by installer are located
in output_dir/tripleo-heat-installer-templates.
Use these defaults as expected directory to collect
as CI artifacts.

Delete unused undercloud-templates-* path

Needed-By: Ic7b8c36804124463a1b0582e3aeeb3019729686b

Change-Id: I89b48240af8baa02c43a560fb71ca9c62dce8d22
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Alter collect heat templates dir from undercloud

output_dir defaults to $HOME in tripleoclient,
and the heat templates deployed by installer are located
in output_dir/tripleo-heat-installer-templates.
Use these defaults as expected directory to collect
as CI artifacts.

Delete unused undercloud-templates-* path

Needed-By: Ic7b8c36804124463a1b0582e3aeeb3019729686b

Change-Id: I89b48240af8baa02c43a560fb71ca9c62dce8d22
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Alter collect heat templates dir from undercloud

output_dir defaults to $HOME in tripleoclient,
and the heat templates deployed by installer are located
in output_dir/tripleo-heat-installer-templates.
Use these defaults as expected directory to collect
as CI artifacts.

Needed-By: Ic7b8c36804124463a1b0582e3aeeb3019729686b

Change-Id: I638a1f9dd58bbefdca592d7f740a224f4d3eac37
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

[{'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-02-16 23:35:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-05 20:32:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2018-03-06 09:06:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This should be squashed into https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545492/'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-06 22:26:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-06 22:28:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> This should be squashed into https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545492/

Done. The two patches is squashed into one.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-06 22:29:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-03-12 08:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I think that some follow up patch with some tempest API test should be added also as depends-on this one'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-03-12 09:30:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-13 20:39:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-13 20:45:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(3 comments)

I split out the support of "null" from this patch since it is controversal. This patch will focus on the support of blank value.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-13 20:48:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-13 20:49:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-03-14 08:07:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I now wonder about one more thing. Should we add shim api extension to make this new feature discoverable? Or it isn't necessary in this case? How other people thing?"}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-03-14 22:01:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

I agree with slawek that we need an extension. At the same time I want to avoid the proliferation of extensions. To that end, why don't we group this patch (and others similar to it) under the effort to address https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1749820, that we discussed in Dublin. In fact, one of the comments in Dublin was that the new filter behavior should be discoverable

Having said this, looking at the ML thread about API filters that you started as a follow up to Dublin, it seems that cdent indicates that the current behavior is flat out wrong and we just should fix it: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128023.html. However, we don't know how many user scripts we are going to break if we just do that. So I wonder if the new extensions should be configurable also. What do you guys think? I can ask him tomorrow in the API WG meeting. I will let you know what he says"}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-03-14 22:02:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

And of course, the new api extension should be accompanied with copious amounts of docs'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-14 22:40:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> I agree with slawek that we need an extension. At the same time I
 > want to avoid the proliferation of extensions. To that end, why
 > don't we group this patch (and others similar to it) under the
 > effort to address https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1749820,
 > that we discussed in Dublin. In fact, one of the comments in Dublin
 > was that the new filter behavior should be discoverable
 > 
 > Having said this, looking at the ML thread about API filters that
 > you started as a follow up to Dublin, it seems that cdent indicates
 > that the current behavior is flat out wrong and we just should fix
 > it: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128023.html.
 > However, we don't know how many user scripts we are going to break
 > if we just do that. So I wonder if the new extensions should be
 > configurable also. What do you guys think? I can ask him tomorrow
 > in the API WG meeting. I will let you know what he says

For me, I don't have strong opinion to make the new extension configurable or not. However, if the preference is to make it configurable, I think the default should be turning it on."}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-03-15 16:48:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I brought the issue of the inconsistent filter behaviors up in the API SIG meeting today: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/api_sig/2018/api_sig.2018-03-15-16.00.log.html#l-119.

Takeaways:

1) Give the user the option to keep the current behavior
2) The new behavior should be the default'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-03-15 17:03:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> I brought the issue of the inconsistent filter behaviors up in the
 > API SIG meeting today: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/api_sig/2018/api_sig.2018-03-15-16.00.log.html#l-119.
 > 
 > Takeaways:
 > 
 > 1) Give the user the option to keep the current behavior
 > 2) The new behavior should be the default

Cool. Thanks Miguel.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-04-10 21:56:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-04-20 20:22:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-04-23 23:13:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-04-23 23:27:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-04-24 19:10:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-04-25 16:36:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-04-25 16:38:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-04-27 21:39:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-04-29 07:44:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 23:35:55.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Support filter attribute with empty string

Change-Id: I9001214de126eb888c2425b6a6275f59ec8478e7
Partial-Bug: #1749304
'}, {'created': '2018-03-05 20:32:47.000000000', 'message': 'Support filter attribute with empty string

This will enable users to filter list result with attributes
with empty value. For example, the request below will list
all unbound ports (unbound ports have blank device_id).

  GET "/ports?device_id="

Change-Id: I9001214de126eb888c2425b6a6275f59ec8478e7
Partial-Bug: #1749304
'}, {'created': '2018-03-06 22:26:14.000000000', 'message': 'Support filter with blank and null values

* Enable users to filter list result with attributes
  with empty value. For example, the request below will list
  all unbound ports (unbound ports have blank device_id):

  GET "/ports?device_id="

* Enable users to filter list result with attributes
  with value 'null' that will be interpreted as None.
  For example, the request below will list all legacy subnets
  (assume the legacy subnets are the ones without subnetpools).

  GET "/subnets?subnetpool_id=null"

Change-Id: I9001214de126eb888c2425b6a6275f59ec8478e7
Partial-Bug: #1749304
'}, {'created': '2018-03-06 22:29:31.000000000', 'message': 'Support filter with blank and null values

* Enable users to filter list result with attributes
  with empty value. For example, the request below will list
  all unbound ports (unbound ports have blank device_id):

  GET "/ports?device_id="

* Enable users to filter list result with attributes
  with value 'null' that will be interpreted as None.
  For example, the request below will list all legacy subnets
  (assume the legacy subnets are the ones without subnetpools).

  GET "/subnets?subnetpool_id=null"

Change-Id: I9001214de126eb888c2425b6a6275f59ec8478e7
Closes-Bug: #1749304

commit_message:
Support filter attribute with empty string

This will enable users to filter list of results with attributes
with empty value. For example, the request below will list
all unbound ports (unbound ports have blank device_id).

  GET "/ports?device_id="

APIImpact
Change-Id: I9001214de126eb888c2425b6a6275f59ec8478e7
Closes-Bug: #1749304

commit_message:
Fix the policy argument in server-group-create

In the "server-group-create" command, multiple policies
can be specified currently. But only one item is allowed
in the nova side. So make the command allow only one policy.

Change-Id: Ifd2d084faa2b849d6ee466d9accbad21b6a4e11b
Closes-Bug: #1767287

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-07 19:32:03.000000000', 'message': "Python 3: Fix eventlet wakeup after signal

With the implementation of PEP 475 in Python 3.5, system calls that fail
with EINTR are automatically restarted. This means that even when creating
greenthreads in a signal handler, eventlet will not wake up until it
sees activity on the file descriptors it is polling or until the next
timer goes off. This can cause the process to appear to hang.

To work around this, raise an exception when exiting the interrupt
handler if the signal occurred while eventlet was polling. This
exception will then be raised by the library call instead of retrying,
and eventlet will catch it using the same logic it uses in Python 2 for
handling EINTR.

Do the same when the signal occurred while eventlet was sleeping. (It
calls sleep() instead of poll() when there are no file descriptors to
poll, only timers.) To emulate Python 2 behaviour, which is to interrupt
sleep but *not* raise an exception, wrap the sleep call to catch and
ignore EINTR exceptions. This is necessary because eventlet doesn't
attempt to catch any exceptions from sleep() like it does from poll().

Change-Id: Ic7ac8244b804784dd60f87ba411ce3236ea1bd90
Closes-Bug: #1705047
"}, {'created': '2018-05-07 19:53:12.000000000', 'message': "Python 3: Fix eventlet wakeup after signal

With the implementation of PEP 475 in Python 3.5, system calls that fail
with EINTR are automatically restarted. This means that even when creating
greenthreads in a signal handler, eventlet will not wake up until it
sees activity on the file descriptors it is polling or until the next
timer goes off. This can cause the process to appear to hang.

To work around this, raise an exception when exiting the interrupt
handler if the signal occurred while eventlet was polling. This
exception will then be raised by the library call instead of retrying,
and eventlet will catch it using the same logic it uses in Python 2 for
handling EINTR.

Do the same when the signal occurred while eventlet was sleeping. (It
calls sleep() instead of poll() when there are no file descriptors to
poll, only timers.) To emulate Python 2 behaviour, which is to interrupt
sleep but *not* raise an exception, wrap the sleep call to catch and
ignore EINTR exceptions. This is necessary because eventlet doesn't
attempt to catch any exceptions from sleep() like it does from poll().

Change-Id: Ic7ac8244b804784dd60f87ba411ce3236ea1bd90
Closes-Bug: #1705047
"}]
commit_message:
Python 3: Fix eventlet wakeup after signal

With the implementation of PEP 475 in Python 3.5, system calls that fail
with EINTR are automatically restarted. This means that even when creating
greenthreads in a signal handler, eventlet will not wake up until it
sees activity on the file descriptors it is polling or until the next
timer goes off. This can cause the process to appear to hang.

To work around this, raise an exception when exiting the interrupt
handler if the signal occurred while eventlet was polling. This
exception will then be raised by the library call instead of retrying,
and eventlet will catch it using the same logic it uses in Python 2 for
handling EINTR.

Do the same when the signal occurred while eventlet was sleeping. (It
calls sleep() instead of poll() when there are no file descriptors to
poll, only timers.) To emulate Python 2 behaviour, which is to interrupt
sleep but *not* raise an exception, wrap the sleep call to catch and
ignore EINTR exceptions. This is necessary because eventlet doesn't
attempt to catch any exceptions from sleep() like it does from poll().

Change-Id: Ic7ac8244b804784dd60f87ba411ce3236ea1bd90
Closes-Bug: #1705047

Adding node_staging_uri parameter to set the staging location
to /var/lib/staging/glance instead of the default one /tmp/staging
as it would be a shared across the nodes in case of 'glance-direct'
image import method.

commit_message:
Add node_staging_uri parameter

Adding node_staging_uri parameter to set the staging location
to /var/lib/staging/glance instead of the default one /tmp/staging
as it would be a shared across the nodes in case of 'glance-direct'
image import method.

Change-Id: Id9b35d5781448f22549d741ab797f656f96c6562
Closes-Bug: #1765439
(cherry picked from commit 761b90937d39cace5147ae373b869ccf1902da12)

commit_message:
RP delete inventories (v1.5)

UpgradeImpact: this change will require a major version
release since a previously required argument (resource_class)
is now an option (--resource_class) for the
"openstack resource provider inventory delete" CLI.

Change-Id: I4be95feeadcbf82ab23fa2709b72db4d4203c1e7
Partially-Implements: blueprint placement-osc-plugin-rocky

commit_message:
Migrate to stestr

This patch updates tox.ini to directly call stestr instead of ostestr
[1]. ostestr is no longer installed by default by infra.

For more info on stestr, please refer to [2].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-September/122135.html
[2] http://stestr.readthedocs.io/en/latest/MANUAL.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550282/
Change-Id: Ie6a275170ec6faf0db3976410660f52078710a54
(cherry picked from commit 7f3506b2956c4f6edc24703ea8099ce783715897)
(cherry picked from commit b10f962a3d0c3dc0ec706099812defcf34bc9877)

subject: Cap haproxy log level severity
messages: [{'account_id': 13478, 'date': '2018-04-20 11:10:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25653, 'date': '2018-05-07 05:55:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-05-07 06:24:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24441, 'date': '2018-05-08 01:23:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-05-08 20:47:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 11:10:00.000000000', 'message': 'Cap haproxy log level severity

With current haproxy config, emerg logs are sent to syslog when there
are no backends available. Emerg logs on most syslog setups are sent
via wall to all users.

This is rarely a wanted behavior. And it might happen quite often
at the configuration phase.

Cap logs to `alert` level. This converts `emerg` logs to `alert`,
which by default are logged to files, and prevents wall-like messages.

This fix is also suggested by haproxy docs:

https://cbonte.github.io/haproxy-dconv/1.7/configuration.html#4.2-log

Change-Id: I4c5ede6d3ef2479fb123dbb6706a7d5090b6e5ec
Closes-Bug: 1362213
(cherry picked from commit 40dd211f269124bad1970daa5609d109a9c2b66b)
'}]
commit_message:
Cap haproxy log level severity

With current haproxy config, emerg logs are sent to syslog when there
are no backends available. Emerg logs on most syslog setups are sent
via wall to all users.

This is rarely a wanted behavior. And it might happen quite often
at the configuration phase.

Cap logs to `alert` level. This converts `emerg` logs to `alert`,
which by default are logged to files, and prevents wall-like messages.

This fix is also suggested by haproxy docs:

https://cbonte.github.io/haproxy-dconv/1.7/configuration.html#4.2-log

Change-Id: I4c5ede6d3ef2479fb123dbb6706a7d5090b6e5ec
Closes-Bug: 1362213
(cherry picked from commit 40dd211f269124bad1970daa5609d109a9c2b66b)

commit_message:
Gate: stop pulling default images

This PS stops pulling the charts default images, as the make file
target cannot target over-rides - resulting in longer gate runs with
twice as many images pulled than required in some cases.

Change-Id: I2a49ab0e8034b0aadc2c06cc347f7d76ef71784a

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/564351/6/ : FAILURE in 2m 58s'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-05-03 21:22:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

So.. posting these comments, but I spent a few hours this afternoon writing a patch that basically removes the need for this patch (and hopefully will line you up nice and straight for the meaty patch that adds the merge candidates stuff).

I had a difficult time trying to explain what felt wrong about this patch. I write inline that something just feels weird about it; like you're coupling something incorrectly in the AllocationRequest object.

That weird feeling led me to this patch, which places all of the "state" that needs to be kept in various iterations of the matching logic into a MatchSpec object. This MatchSpec object is constructed from a list of RequestGroup objects and has methods to extract particular pieces of information about sharing providers and various maps/lookups for ID to name translation.

commit_message:
placement: Object changes for granular

To implement the merge-and-filter algorithm for granular resource
requests later in this code series, a handful of object changes are
needed.  This change set just makes those alterations.

Change-Id: I446f7534e7f3b27f71683283ce4a8fd361fc05a7
blueprint: granular-resource-requests

commit_message:
Use Xenial packages for Bionic

The official Ceph repos for Bionic is not
there yet, so this will try to use the Xenial
packages and see if they work without any
dependency issues.

Change-Id: I8f13ab9b8e0df4b7156f21429038af36d8660a80

Add the undercloud mistral user to the docker group

operations (pull, build, push).

[{'created': '2018-04-25 16:35:49.000000000', 'message': 'Bump pypowervm minimum to 1.1.15

The referenced bug is fixed in pypowervm 1.1.15.  Without the fix,
PowerVM device detach during destroy (and therefore PowerVM CI) is
broken.

Change-Id: Icaabadfb17dd87207d99938224713a78dc925674
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/564275/
Closes-Bug: #1766692
'}]
commit_message:
Bump pypowervm minimum to 1.1.15

The referenced bug is fixed in pypowervm 1.1.15.  Without the fix,
PowerVM device detach during destroy (and therefore PowerVM CI) is
broken.

Change-Id: Icaabadfb17dd87207d99938224713a78dc925674
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/564275/
Closes-Bug: #1766692

commit_message:
Remove deprecated rabbit params

Remove the deprecated rabbit params which have been deprecated
for two years. The default_transport_url has been present for
a while now and should be used. Rabbit params have already been
removed from some puppet modules, see for example change
I337249e64bb5c3379db60f71608fb2d39b600294

commit_message:
Add logging to capabilities filter

The capabilities filter gets incorrectly blamed for a lot of
deployment failures because on a retry of a node deployment the
filter has to fail because there is only one node that can match
when using predictable placement.  However, we don't have any
logging to help determine why the filter fails.  This adds logging
to explain why nodes fell through, which will hopefully help with
debugging these problems.

Change-Id: I702209e9b5a1e546bf8cb784eec8bdc3c97c63eb
Closes-Bug: 1718502
(cherry picked from commit e5d16155364c1dae2db238506f236194e2dfb1dc)

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Conflicts:
	tox.ini

Related-Bug: #1765065
Change-Id: I4f73c304de9474946c604726aba6e84cb7863431
(cherry picked from commit cc9376a9c9ab78fbfa92a3708ba464618b57f521)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-19 10:45:13.000000000', 'message': '[Newton only] Do not overwrite current neutron::host value.

In newton we are setting the neutron::host value explicitly.  The
problem is that due to [1] and the fact the L3 agents are in HA
mode, the previous defined workloads on those agent get lost and FIPs
become unreachable.

This patch check the current live value through a fact and set the
neutron::host value to it.

This is newton only has we have another patch ensuring that, once set
that, that value is never rewritten[2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560855/
[2] need to be backported to ocata https://review.openstack.org/#/q/I8f075a5ad869ef0dc72a700dcb7be0b6efca787a

Change-Id: Ieb92ff161d1684c214382c5eb6b5949efc3fe75c

'}, {'created': '2018-04-23 09:02:36.000000000', 'message': "[Newton only] Do not overwrite current {neutron,nova}::host value.

In newton we are setting both nova::host and neutron::host values
explicitly to the fqdn.

This can cause problem during upgrade from Mitaka.  The previous host
value (defaulting to python socket.gethostname) could return only the
hostname[0] then when upgrade we thus changing this identifier.  At
restart nova/neutron create *new* agents.  Those agents are then
unaware of existing workload.

For neutron, the problem is that due to [1] and the fact the L3 agents
are in HA mode, the previous defined workloads on those agent get lost
and FIPs become unreachable.

For nova it's no longer possible to send commands to (before upgrade)
existing vm anymore.

This patch check the current live value of the host parameter through
a fact and set the nova::host and neutron::host value to it if we are
not in a deployment (upgrade/update)

For nova, we directly use nova-manage to get the current live value.
Using the mysql parameter directly has the advantage that it's defined
on all type of node (controller *and* compute).  As a matter of fact
the auth required parameter are usually not defined on compute node.

For neutron, when auth is available in the configuration (on
Controller) we use that.  There is no neutron-manage equivalent here
so we use the nova value when auth is unavailable.  When host is unset
they both use python.gethostname, so it should be the same value.
Using auth on controller add another level of confidence though.  And
the controller are where the l3 agents are, so better be safe than
sorry.

This patch is newton only as it's where we are setting for the first
time this parameter.  After that (ocata on) we use[2] to make sure
that those parameters are never rewritten.

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1499201
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560855/
[2] need to be backported to ocata https://review.openstack.org/#/q/I8f075a5ad869ef0dc72a700dcb7be0b6efca787a

Partial-Bug: #1763322
Change-Id: Ieb92ff161d1684c214382c5eb6b5949efc3fe75c

commit_message:
[Newton only] Do not overwrite current {neutron,nova}::host value.

In newton we are setting both nova::host and neutron::host values
explicitly to the fqdn.

This can cause problem during upgrade from Mitaka.  The previous host
value (defaulting to python socket.gethostname) could return only the
hostname[0].  It means that during upgrade we are changing this
identifier.  At restart nova/neutron creates *new* agents.  Those
agents are then unaware of existing workload.

For neutron, the problem is that due to [1] and the fact the L3 agents
are in HA mode, the previous defined workloads on those agent get lost
and FIPs become unreachable.

For nova it's no longer possible to send commands to (before upgrade)
existing vm anymore.

This patch checks the current live value of the host parameter through
a fact and set the nova::host and neutron::host value to it if we are
not in a deployment (upgrade/update)

For nova, we directly use nova-manage to get the current live value.
Using the mysql parameter directly has the advantage that it's defined
on all types of node (controller *and* compute).  As a matter of fact
the required auth parameters are usually not defined on compute node.

For neutron, when auth is available in the configuration (on
Controller) we use that.  There is no neutron-manage equivalent here
so we use the nova value when auth is unavailable.  When host is unset
they both use python.gethostname, so it should be the same value.
Using auth on controller add another level of confidence though.  And
the controller are where the l3 agents are, so better be safe than
sorry.

This patch is newton only as it's where we are setting for the first
time this parameter.  After that (ocata on) we use[2] to make sure
that those parameters are never rewritten.

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1499201
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560855/
[2] need to be backported to ocata https://review.openstack.org/#/q/I8f075a5ad869ef0dc72a700dcb7be0b6efca787a

Partial-Bug: #1763322
Change-Id: Ieb92ff161d1684c214382c5eb6b5949efc3fe75c

commit_message:
Update the fast forward workflow to use CLI commands

This change adjusts the fast forward upgrade workflow to use the
Openstack CLI commands instead of running manual ansible commands.

Change-Id: I345500444ed47d631593d96e4a192e179e4bb326

[{'created': '2018-04-24 15:00:22.000000000', 'message': "Prepare for DLRN modular build driver structure

Previously, the delorean_setup function modified DLRN's build_rpm.sh
script to make sure that the built rpms would not be installed as
part of the mock build in its chroot.

Since [1], DLRN will change the way it builds packages to use a driver
structure, and the build_rpm.sh script will no longer exist. On
the flip side, the default mock driver gives an option to skip
installation in the mock call, so we can simply use it.

[1] - https://softwarefactory-project.io/r/12039

Change-Id: I278da2ddf15a0b23ab522e63ac58c93043c4816f

commit_message:
Prepare for DLRN modular build driver structure

Previously, the delorean_setup function modified DLRN's build_rpm.sh
script to make sure that the built rpms would not be installed as
part of the mock build in its chroot.

Since [1], DLRN will change the way it builds packages to use a driver
structure, and the build_rpm.sh script will no longer exist. On
the flip side, the default mock driver gives an option to skip
installation in the mock call, so we can simply use it.

[1] - https://softwarefactory-project.io/r/12039

Change-Id: I278da2ddf15a0b23ab522e63ac58c93043c4816f

commit_message:
Remove Bandit from the Governance Repository

This is step 5 of the retiring-a-project wiki to remove bandit as
an OpenStack project [1].

Bandit will now be located on GitHub as part of PyCQA. Further
information on this migration can be found in the etherpad [2].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project
[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/bandit-migration

Change-Id: I6f5dc5e969c82c8adae5d80438e117e8dc3085fc

The patch I5857e927a830914c96e040936804e322baccc24c changed the
error message emited by placement and that broke the
test_fail_if_incorrect_aggregate_uuid functional test of the

commit_message:
Fix error message in test assert

The patch I5857e927a830914c96e040936804e322baccc24c changed the
error message emitted by placement and that broke the
test_fail_if_incorrect_aggregate_uuid functional test of the
client as it was asserting the old error message.

Actually the test does not check any client behavior as the client
does not do UUID validation. Therefore this patch removes this
test case.

Change-Id: If5fc16d50af1f8f60735ab81d1f5d138c9ad104b
Closes-Bug: #1768495

[{'created': '2018-05-08 17:10:49.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore several hacking rule

The new hacking is released which made over "pep8" check fail.
I do not find this checks useful and even more, it blocks us to make
release. So let's just ignore them.

  E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
  W503 line break before binary operator

Change-Id: Ife8cfb886c97fc8712bec8445c4c3241a98ccbd5
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore several hacking rule

The new hacking is released which made over "pep8" check fail.
I do not find this checks useful and even more, it blocks us to make
release. So let's just ignore them.

  E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
  W503 line break before binary operator

Change-Id: Ife8cfb886c97fc8712bec8445c4c3241a98ccbd5

Since SPECTRE/MELTDOWN we have lots of tempest timeouts in
our container builds.

This tries to mitigate the effects by increasing the default

Change-Id: I0e50535d2400bd891dee0dbc4f2f0df6fa8a40d7
(cherry picked from commit c5dcd038c7ad1d87f9190c3237861fd167f5980e)

commit_message:
Overriding default tempest timeouts

Since SPECTRE/MELTDOWN we have lots of tempest timeouts in
our container builds.

This tries to mitigate the effects by increasing the default
delays. Defaults are now doubled.

Change-Id: I0e50535d2400bd891dee0dbc4f2f0df6fa8a40d7
(cherry picked from commit c5dcd038c7ad1d87f9190c3237861fd167f5980e)

commit_message:
Adding ansible-role-tripleo-keystone

Based on the newly introduced paradigm of per-repository
Ansible roles for tripleo component management, this is
the first repo in a series that contains Ansible tooling,
this time for keystone.

Change-Id: Ic016538588afdb1d483ab892a1d4b17fc77b5dd4
Needed-By: Iae44a6c87f92b21b9385773f75c8d9cbb6699f83

commit_message:
Remove vagrant scripts from the repo

As far as we are concerned no one is using the vagrant scripts from the
repository. This adds an unnecessary maintenance overhead.

This commit removes vagrant scripts from the repository.

Change-Id: Ic6659df062ee92ea67dc8bc0f9928b9db275f015

DeployedServerPortMap returned non-empty values.

Empty values returned from the get_param call is usually a sign of user
