revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-06 18:01:37.000000000', 'message': 'ODL DHCP Port to be created only for IPv4 subnets.

OpenDaylight DHCP service only supports ARP Responder
feature for IPv4 subnets today. This fix will avoid
creation of a DHCP port for IPv6 subnets and ensure
no processing of these ports happens from ODL for
DHCP/IPv6 services.

OpenDaylight IPv6 service internally creates improper
bindings on these ports leading to inconsistencies in the
OpenDaylight environment.

Closes-Bug: 1746715

Cherry-picked from commit Id4a493aa2dfbd21b6d3cff666eaf44f58a3aec1f

Change-Id: Id4a493aa2dfbd21b6d3cff666eaf44f58a3aec1f
'}]
commit_message:
ODL DHCP Port to be created only for IPv4 subnets.

OpenDaylight DHCP service only supports ARP Responder
feature for IPv4 subnets today. This fix will avoid
creation of a DHCP port for IPv6 subnets and ensure
no processing of these ports happens from ODL for
DHCP/IPv6 services.

OpenDaylight IPv6 service internally creates improper
bindings on these ports leading to inconsistencies in the
OpenDaylight environment.

Closes-Bug: 1746715

Cherry-picked from commit Id4a493aa2dfbd21b6d3cff666eaf44f58a3aec1f

Change-Id: Id4a493aa2dfbd21b6d3cff666eaf44f58a3aec1f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-07 09:58:27.000000000', 'message': 'devstack: support non-legacy neutron

This adjust the devstack plugin code to work in the case
where new neutron devstack service names (neuyton-*) are
used instead of the neutron-legacy devstack services names (q-*).

Change-Id: I55aefa9ac1aaf0f69a7a31365439141633183722

commit_message:
devstack: support non-legacy neutron

This adjust the devstack plugin code to work in the case
where new neutron devstack service names (neuyton-*) are
used instead of the neutron-legacy devstack services names (q-*).

Change-Id: I55aefa9ac1aaf0f69a7a31365439141633183722
Partial-Bug: 1769601

messages:
[{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-11 15:59:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-04-16 06:20:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-04-17 08:14:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I273cca5f6beb8a7e6f325dd7db5449e089c61919
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Trim whitespace in Neutron configuration file for LBaaS
messages: [{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-05-08 00:38:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-08 07:07:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-05-08 07:22:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-08 00:38:18.000000000', 'message': "Trim whitespace in Neutron configuration file for LBaaS

If neutron_lbaasv2 is set to true, the if statement is evaluated
and an extra 2 spaces are added.  This results in two spaces being
added before the '# General, applies to all host groups' which
results in config_template being unable to parse the file in
addition to Neutron failing to parse the configuration as well.

Change-Id: I4e04e1b9e6219d60c703240d01d6bf8a1a32ccda
(cherry picked from commit 30e20d6cd7a6a248aa2336f501e3de9b47f263be)
"}]
commit_message:
Trim whitespace in Neutron configuration file for LBaaS

If neutron_lbaasv2 is set to true, the if statement is evaluated
and an extra 2 spaces are added.  This results in two spaces being
added before the '# General, applies to all host groups' which
results in config_template being unable to parse the file in
addition to Neutron failing to parse the configuration as well.

Change-Id: I4e04e1b9e6219d60c703240d01d6bf8a1a32ccda
(cherry picked from commit 30e20d6cd7a6a248aa2336f501e3de9b47f263be)

subject: Fix "key_repository is world readable: /etc/keystone/fernet-keys/" warning
messages:
[{'account_id': 28188, 'date': '2018-05-04 15:13:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-05-04 15:13:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 21691, 'date': '2018-05-04 15:21:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-05-07 09:05:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2018-05-07 14:40:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24441, 'date': '2018-05-08 01:09:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22582, 'date': '2018-05-08 07:51:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

ANd where is it used?'}, {'account_id': 26899, 'date': '2018-05-01 07:48:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Added boolean operator to indicate SRIOV capabilities

This change adds a boolean flag to tempest config, enables
the user to indicate whether the setup supports
SRIOV functionality.

Change-Id: I66f05a31703baaa7bc813df3897d1b736fba8138

subject: Add number of failure tests in RSS feeds
messages: [{'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2018-05-08 07:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-08 07:22:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add number of failure tests in RSS feeds

This commit adds a number of failure tests in RSS feeds. That number
could be huge like more than 100. The number can be seen in a tempest
log, however, it could be useful if we can see it in RSS feeds in some
cases.

Change-Id: I653f95670d8fcaac694e7d23f05517ca04549071
'}]
commit_message:
Add number of failure tests in RSS feeds

This commit adds a number of failure tests in RSS feeds. That number
could be huge like more than 100. The number can be seen in a tempest
log, however, it could be useful if we can see it in RSS feeds in some
cases.

Change-Id: I653f95670d8fcaac694e7d23f05517ca04549071

messages:
[{'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-04-30 21:24:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-04-30 21:52:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-05-01 14:13:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-05-07 18:48:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-30 21:24:42.000000000', 'message': 'Don't override quickstart_install log

When running multiple playbooks, quickstart_install log contains
only the last log. Add "-a" to "tee" to save logs from all
playbooks.

Change-Id: Ib02190f0bfaad03383c1c3b09579711e5a5f8c27
'}]
commit_message:
Don't override quickstart_install log

When running multiple playbooks, quickstart_install log contains
only the last log. Add "-a" to "tee" to save logs from all
playbooks.

Change-Id: Ib02190f0bfaad03383c1c3b09579711e5a5f8c27

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-07 21:03:17.000000000', 'message': 'Update RDO install guide for v3

Bring the RDO install guide into alignment with the Ubuntu and SUSE
guides by removing references to the admin port 35357 that was used for
the keystone v2 API.

Change-Id: Ic2c5452dae0c142ce3311f6b5e6d9590d618fc22
(cherry picked from commit 27762c822067c383d543d06ad39a3c0ad4375b45)

commit_message:
Update RDO install guide for v3

Bring the RDO install guide into alignment with the Ubuntu and SUSE
guides by removing references to the admin port 35357 that was used for
the keystone v2 API.

Change-Id: Ic2c5452dae0c142ce3311f6b5e6d9590d618fc22
(cherry picked from commit 27762c822067c383d543d06ad39a3c0ad4375b45)

subject: Remove dead code in token provider
messages: [{'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-05-03 20:57:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2018-05-03 21:56:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-05-04 09:12:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-05-08 05:00:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 20:57:47.000000000', 'message': "Remove dead code in token provider

The _verify_token_ref() method is a dead section of code that was
last called in:

  I62cc1d5efbe0869fd0e501aaa9405ff0b0da0e5e

This commit removes the method since it is no longer called anywhere
and hasn't since the Icehouse release.

Change-Id: I1b6ed09e9c9ad9214cd6e2c0f5849bb8550fbf3f
"}]
commit_message:
Remove dead code in token provider

The _verify_token_ref() method is a dead section of code that was
last called in:

  I62cc1d5efbe0869fd0e501aaa9405ff0b0da0e5e

This commit removes the method since it is no longer called anywhere
and hasn't since the Icehouse release.

Change-Id: I1b6ed09e9c9ad9214cd6e2c0f5849bb8550fbf3f

commit_message:
Remove unused exception

The ValidationSizeError exception was never actually used anywhere in
the code base. This commit removes it.

Change-Id: I748b0ecc17ef67c3f8555cb2d2e6c8846bb684c4

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-27 07:49:54.000000000', 'message': '[WiP] Add opentracing to global requirements

Add opentracing and related libraries to OpenStack global requirements.

Notes:
  - This work is in progress.
  - On the way to make OpenStack OSprofiler compatible with CNCF OpenTracing.

Some questions:
>>> Is the library actively maintained?
Yes, a link for it: https://github.com/opentracing/opentracing-python

>>> Is the library good code?
Yes

>>> Is the library python 3 compatible?
Yes, on the way: https://github.com/opentracing/opentracing-python/pull/53

>>> Is the library license compatible?
Yes, it is under MIT license

>>> Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev
>>> or infrastructure setup? Which?
Yes, this change: I8f75af487f50d5e67a1321a4c951d2a0d85733a1

>>> When will this land?
This patch is expected to land on Queens. Not Pike.

Related change: I8f75af487f50d5e67a1321a4c951d2a0d85733a1

Change-Id: Iaac3ac3853867a67f7e386e762e0522076235daf

commit_message:
Add opentracing to global requirements

Add opentracing and related libraries to OpenStack global requirements.

Notes:
  - This work is in progress.
  - On the way to make OpenStack OSprofiler compatible with CNCF OpenTracing.

Some questions:
>>> Is the library actively maintained?
Yes, a link for it: https://github.com/opentracing/opentracing-python

>>> Is the library good code?
Yes

>>> Is the library python 3 compatible?
Yes

>>> Is the library license compatible?
Yes, it is under Apache 2.0 license

>>> Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev
>>> or infrastructure setup? Which?
Yes, this change: I8f75af487f50d5e67a1321a4c951d2a0d85733a1

>>> When will this land?
This patch is expected to land on Rocky

Related change: I8f75af487f50d5e67a1321a4c951d2a0d85733a1

Change-Id: Iaac3ac3853867a67f7e386e762e0522076235daf

commit_message:
Do not filter pools by attributes when non are provided

This change stops the AttributeFilter from filtering when no
attributes were provided.

This also removes the pool_id attribte from the request, as this
is used in a different filter.

Change-Id: If57d81e0343fa442828da7390bf20249f4791861
(cherry picked from commit c6ee02d71af602e2db768605eef6f03fe14fbd70)

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I3c4282f0bc2ddedf816f366cd058823777ecdab9
Co-Authored-By: Michel Peterson <michel@redhat.com>

commit_message:
xenapi: Use XAPI pool instead of aggregate pool for shared SR migration

xenapi is going to support pool-based multi-hosts OpenStack
environments, this patch is used to remove dependency to the
old aggregate-based-pools and add support to xenapi pool.
Also include unit test changes.
Updated configuring migrations document:
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/configuring-
migrations.html#configuring-migrations-xenserver-shared-storage
Other related documents will be updated in another patch.

Implements: blueprint live-migration-in-xapi-pool
Change-Id: I2c492c46e85c1df96aa7fdc12cdee0b1c7ba775e

commit_message:
Use immutable journal path rather than device name

Device name is mutable when removed or added disks. Use uuid path or
lable is more robust.

Change-Id: I95cae6a9bf185d6f81126c42ac72d51b5ed659c2
Closes-Bug: #1710058

Beginning with the Queens release, the keystone install guide
recommends running all interfaces on the same port. This patch
updates the install guide to reflect that change.

Change-Id: Ice155d0b80d2f2ed6c1a9a9738be2184b6e9e76c
Closes-bug: #1754104

commit_message:
Update auth_url in install docs

Beginning with the Queens release, the keystone install guide
recommends running all interfaces on the same port. This patch
updates the install guide to reflect that change.

Change-Id: Ice155d0b80d2f2ed6c1a9a9738be2184b6e9e76c
Closes-bug: #1754104

commit_message:
Drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20 from queens jobs

Django 2.0 support was deferred to Rocky, so there is no reason
to run py35dj20 for queens changes.

Change-Id: Ie4f1894b6e15d833aab9ec605f760e4b0f46253a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 09:51:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unstable test case

The DatabaseConfigurationsTests.test_values_tab_discard_action
test is unstable, failing and succeeding on subsequent runs.

The root cause of the instability is the django local memory cache
used by the test cases. This cache has defaults that will cull
33% of the cache entries when it reaches its max capacity of 300.

During the test runs the cache becomes full and the culling will
randomly choose to cull the cached configuratoin being used by the
test case about 33% of the time. This leads to test case failure.

In a production environment the cache used is memcached which has
different behavior. If the cache entry were still culled, for the
"discard changes" option, that would be equivalent to a discard
since the configuration manager would re-fetch.

In the test case flow it breaks because the 'changed values'
fetch gets a cache miss.

The fix is to set the cache configuration for the tests to use
a higher max_entries value and change the cull frequency to only
cull 5% of the entries every cull.

Change-Id: I44bcf14c4ed17505de94b44b01ffcccd818399b7
(cherry picked from commit 220433719e1035398a386339984e522116e55762)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unstable test case

The DatabaseConfigurationsTests.test_values_tab_discard_action
test is unstable, failing and succeeding on subsequent runs.

The root cause of the instability is the django local memory cache
used by the test cases. This cache has defaults that will cull
33% of the cache entries when it reaches its max capacity of 300.

During the test runs the cache becomes full and the culling will
randomly choose to cull the cached configuratoin being used by the
test case about 33% of the time. This leads to test case failure.

In a production environment the cache used is memcached which has
different behavior. If the cache entry were still culled, for the
"discard changes" option, that would be equivalent to a discard
since the configuration manager would re-fetch.

In the test case flow it breaks because the 'changed values'
fetch gets a cache miss.

The fix is to set the cache configuration for the tests to use
a higher max_entries value and change the cull frequency to only
cull 5% of the entries every cull.

Change-Id: I44bcf14c4ed17505de94b44b01ffcccd818399b7
(cherry picked from commit 220433719e1035398a386339984e522116e55762)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-07 02:48:35.000000000', 'message': 'Allow image prepare to only filter by role data

Currently if no resource registry is in the environment passed to
prepare, then every image will be filtered out of the result.

Sometimes it is useful to only provide the role data and still have
filtered images on what services are enabled in the roles. This change
makes that possible

This change also returns a None service filter when provided None
roles data. This is to ensure no filtering occurs when no role data
file is specified.

Change-Id: Id2b787f148709506df4a0619103850051f786e29
Closes-Bug: #1769549
'}]
commit_message:
Allow image prepare to only filter by role data

Currently if no resource registry is in the environment passed to
prepare, then every image will be filtered out of the result.

Sometimes it is useful to only provide the role data and still have
filtered images on what services are enabled in the roles. This change
makes that possible

This change also returns a None service filter when provided None
roles data. This is to ensure no filtering occurs when no role data
file is specified.

Change-Id: Id2b787f148709506df4a0619103850051f786e29
Closes-Bug: #1769549

commit_message:
Give volume DriverBlockDevice classes a common prefix

This makes the code slightly easier to understand, for example because
it's more obvious that DriverVolImageBlockDevice is a volume. It will
also be less confusing when we add DriverLocalImageBlockDevice in a
future patch.

Rename things in test_block_device for the same reasons.

Part of bp local-disk-serial-numbers

Change-Id: I5aa41a675d79945df6293f46eeb1a2fcc67241fb

commit_message:
Improve resource cleaning mechanism

1. when we specify a class of resource like "neutron", all neutron
resource will be listed and filtered.

2. Now when creating new resource like network, it will be recorded.
After tests, only network of neutron class will be listed and filterd.

Change-Id: I3fdfbac431bd514cb9a7015064de389b91fd2f3b

commit_message:
Exclude Project By Audit Scope

This patch adds project_id in compute CDM, It also adds logic for
excluding project_id in audit scope.

Change-Id: Ife228e3d1855b65abee637516470e463ba8a2815
Implements: blueprint audit-scope-exclude-project

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more details information, please refer to:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html

Co-Authored-By: Hongbin Lu <hongbin034@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I94afabfc634ae22fb6e0e4ab2e1d17810f6f7c80
Closes-Bug: #1758218

commit_message:
undercloud: switch to the "direct" deploy interface by default

Instead of serving images via slow and somewhat unreliable iSCSI protocol,
this deploy method makes IPA download them from the undercloud Swift.

Change-Id: Ic569358b781337ec6ba8ba802ada1f940917bd61
Implements: blueprint ironic-direct-deploy

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 19:25:37.000000000', 'message': "Enable cleanup by default for undercloud install

The goal of this change is to remove the randomly generated data that we
we use during the installation of the undercloud by default.  This
change switches the cleanup configuration in the undercloud.conf to
be true by default so we cleanup the generated heat temporary files by
default. The undercloud deploy flag still remains the same where it is
not currently enabled by default if you leverage the 'openstack
undercloud deploy' command.

Change-Id: I027a76d2f37a5af5bd0a599783287632298acf3f
Related-Bug: #1761810

commit_message:
Enable cleanup by default for undercloud install

The goal of this change is to remove the randomly generated data that we
we use during the installation of the undercloud by default.  This
change switches the cleanup configuration in the undercloud.conf to
be true by default so we cleanup the generated heat temporary files by
default. The undercloud deploy flag still remains the same where it is
not currently enabled by default if you leverage the 'openstack
undercloud deploy' command.

Change-Id: I027a76d2f37a5af5bd0a599783287632298acf3f
Related-Bug: #1761810

commit_message:
Add docs to local test tox

Zuul gate currently supports build-openstack-sphinx-docs,
therefor, this change adds docs to tox for local test.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-04 21:29:22.000000000', 'message': "PXE Filter dnsmasq: blacklist unknown host

The iptables filter driver blocks DHCP requests on the
Inspector interface unless one or more nodes are on
introspection and node_not_found_hook is not set.

This change brings the dnsmasq filter driver to parity
by implementing logic similar to the iptables driver.

Unless one or more nodes are on introspection and
node_not_found_hook is not set a dhcp_hostsdir ignore
record for wildcard mac '*:*:*:*:*:*' is maintained.

Related: RH Bz1574672
Story: 2001970
Task: 16864
Change-Id: Ibdd2210ecb3833a0d91205a7919122b7c0576b9e

commit_message:
PXE Filter dnsmasq: blacklist unknown host

Unless one or more nodes are on introspection and
node_not_found_hook is not set a dhcp_hostsdir ignore
record for wildcard mac '*:*:*:*:*:*' is maintained.

The iptables filter driver blocks DHCP requests on the
Inspector interface unless one or more nodes are on
introspection and node_not_found_hook is not set.

This change brings the dnsmasq filter driver to parity
by implementing logic similar to the iptables driver.

Related: rhbz#1574672
Story: 2001970
Task: 16864
Change-Id: Ibdd2210ecb3833a0d91205a7919122b7c0576b9e

I saw a couple of mail threads regarding requirements handling, but could not recall what is the exact process now... While we are removing lower bounds in the project will there be still some place where global lower bounds are defined? Is there a job that verifies that project's requirements fit into the global one?"}, {'account_id': 23630, 'date': '2018-05-03 10:22:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I saw a couple of mail threads regarding requirements handling, but

 > where global lower bounds are defined? Is there a job that verifies
 > that project's requirements fit into the global one?

Yes, it will be verify in global requirement.
You can see it here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557034/"}, {'account_id': 5950, 'date': '2018-05-07 07:11:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9171, 'date': '2018-05-07 19:31:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 23630, 'date': '2018-05-08 00:49:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Overhaul HealthManager update threading

* Switch to ProcessPool from ThreadPool (Python threads are horrible)
* Load the health/stats update drivers correctly with stevedore
* Add logging driver

Change-Id: Icda4ff218a6bbaea252c2d75c073754f4161a597
(cherry picked from commit f9dafb9a7a521783f8dfb9df6cdcfa0368be5bc5)

[{'created': '2018-04-24 16:01:31.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Proxy is_volume through DriverBlockDevice

To resolve this TODO in the ironic virt driver [1], and because the
PowerVM driver is facing similar difficulties [2], this change proxies
the is_volume @property from BlockDeviceMapping through
DriverBlockDevice and thus its inheritors, including
DriverVolumeBlockDevice, which is what a bdm actually seems to be by the
time it gets to a virt driver.

WIP: test

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/1605391084d6a1f57384ef48bad8ca2185cf6fa7/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py#L392-L397
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526094/45/nova/virt/powervm/driver.py@559

Change-Id: I3976a9305e0583ee77295df3636926688a1ca4ce
'}, {'created': '2018-04-24 20:39:15.000000000', 'message': 'Proxy is_volume through DriverBlockDevice

To resolve this TODO in the ironic virt driver [1], and because the
PowerVM driver is facing similar difficulties [2], this change proxies
the is_volume @property from BlockDeviceMapping through
DriverBlockDevice and thus its inheritors, including
DriverVolumeBlockDevice, which is what a bdm actually seems to be by the
time it gets to a virt driver.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/1605391084d6a1f57384ef48bad8ca2185cf6fa7/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py#L392-L397
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526094/45/nova/virt/powervm/driver.py@559

Change-Id: I3976a9305e0583ee77295df3636926688a1ca4ce
'}]
commit_message:
Proxy is_volume through DriverBlockDevice

To resolve this TODO in the ironic virt driver [1], and because the
PowerVM driver is facing similar difficulties [2], this change proxies
the is_volume @property from BlockDeviceMapping through
DriverBlockDevice and thus its inheritors, including
DriverVolumeBlockDevice, which is what a bdm actually seems to be by the
time it gets to a virt driver.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/1605391084d6a1f57384ef48bad8ca2185cf6fa7/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py#L392-L397
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526094/45/nova/virt/powervm/driver.py@559

Change-Id: I3976a9305e0583ee77295df3636926688a1ca4ce

commit_message:
[DellEMC]Update Manila Unity driver

This patch adds following 3 options:

* network_plugin_ipv6_enabled
* emc_ssl_cert_verify
* emc_ssl_cert_path

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/562532

Change-Id: Ic0391618cf00413d6adc0ed3cba97eb76793c36a
(cherry picked from commit 79719a11ccde300aefcf3d98a8a55afdf3c09edd)

commit_message:
Add support of netapp configuration for glance in THT

This change adds all the required netapp environment configuartion
for glance in heat template.

Change-Id: Ib44796f77cbc50c3b3c37dcdd37a59f48a7baa1a
Closes-Bug: #1740456
(cherry picked from commit 5f7fdb165695b9717cfae6de6b22b0d7e23c7fc3)
Conflicts:
        docker/services/glance-api.yaml

commit_message:
Send a message every time we get the stack

This allows clients to get live updates on the stack status when the
workflow gets them. Otherwise they will need to wait for the workflow
and poll the stack.

Change-Id: I55945adb5bd7d3159248e262f4b510c59c897ebb

Yeah I think that handles showing the ansible playbook output, but we also need to show the heat events, which I guess we can do via polling heat still, but for the UI it'd be helpful if we could stream the events down the zaqar queue I think?

If that's the way we go then I assume we'd want to align both the CLI and UI on the same approach"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-03-20 10:38:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

So I tried this (with a modified tripleoclient, I'll push this when I've done some more testing as it's pretty WIP atm), and it works but we do have an issue when the configuration phase fails:

    "result": "Failure caused by error in tasks: send_message\n\n  send_message [task_ex_id=a7c97c94-5a5c-4547-a723-b139bea33ee5] -> None\n    [wf_ex_id=102134ba-76f4-4a34-8494-03360a1817a0, idx=0]: None\n", 
    "message": "Ansible failed, check log at /var/lib/mistral/43735f41-3e8c-4352-a6dc-1de194f2fd1f/ansible.log.", 
    "inventory": "/var/lib/mistral/43735f41-3e8c-4352-a6dc-1de194f2fd1f/tripleo-ansible-inventory.yaml"

The CLI output isn't that clear as we lose the actual task which failed, any failure says send_message failed I think?'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-03-20 13:14:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

Looks good, a couple of nits inline. I am going to further test this directly with tripleo-ui as I am starting to work on adding config download deployment support'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-03-20 14:08:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thanks for this, it seems like a good start, but I think we need a way to monitor the heat events or this doesn't provide a drop-in replacement for the current tripleoclient usage?"}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-03-20 14:31:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-03-20 18:58:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-03-20 19:00:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

> We need to both poll the queue for messages and poll the workflow status, as the workflow can fail independently from an action 

Hmm, that kind of takes us full-circle, e.g how do we persist that to swift via https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425060/ - we can have a client poll the execution status, but we can't be reliant on a client to set the final status e.g someone may kick off a deploy then close the UI, then check back later?"}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-03-21 10:18:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-03-21 12:14:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-03-21 22:18:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-03-22 16:56:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

As a side note, even though the flag defaults to false, when you enable it this is a completely different workflow from a client perspective (it's synchronous and the pattern re polling for zaqar messages vs events from heat is different), so I wonder if we should make this a v2 deploy workflow, even if all that does internally is call this with the flag set to true?"}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-03-23 10:54:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-03-27 13:08:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

So before introducing config-download we used Heat to track information about deployment status. Since running the deployment now gets more complicated then just running 'heat stack create', we need to create a new layer which will take care of tracking the deployment state.

With this patch and its dependency, we're trying to invent a solution for storing workflow executions, currently by storing execution-like objects from messages sent by the workflows. This solution is not really helpful for the clients as they have to maintain the logic of gathering relevant executions data and calculate the deployment state from it. As we are finding out, we would have to send messages also at the beginning of the workflows so clients know that some operation already started.

I think instead of doing all that, we should just let the workflows update the deployment state. And replace what Heat did since deployment is not just heat now.

So we could maintain a deployment state in JSON data structure in single Swift Object per plan and let relevant workflows (deploy_plan, config_download_deploy, undeploy_plan...) update this state via common action. There is no overhead as we would have to send messages and do the persistence anyway. Running one Swift update object call will end up being even cheaper than messages solution.

With this in place, determining deployment state by client is just a matter of single get object request to Swift. This brings performance and simplicity to the client while keeping the same requirements on the Mistral workflows side.

As a downside of this approach, one could think, is that Mistral becomes necessity to properly track the deployment. Yes, but I don't think it is a downside though. It is something we IMHO want to do. Since the deployment is no more just a Heat, we need to create an API and database to track deployment progress, TripleO Mistral workflows are the API, Swift container is the database."}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-03-27 13:20:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> I think instead of doing all that, we should just let the workflows update the deployment state.

But right now there is no concept of "deployment state" other than the messages - would it not be simpler to just send an in-progress messsage and track the last persisted message for the status?

The advantage of this is we don't have to update some new status abstraction and also send a message to the client, we can do both in the workflow Dougal has already proposed?'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-03-28 12:29:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Optionally run config download at the end of stack create/update

Introduce a boolean input to the deploy workflow to have it
run the config_download workflow once the stack create/update has
completed.

Implements: blueprint config-download-workflows
Co-Authored-By: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Tomasek <jtomasek@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ied0f9422473bdf6d4fedd061c292725edd33feaa

commit_message:
Do not return all the limits for POST request.

During Rocky PTG, We decided that the create apis for
registered limit and project limit should not return all
the limits.

They should only return the ones in the request body.

Change-Id: I26c37198861735bf85eb79570f192c71c7dd9941
Partial-Bug: #1754184

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 19:45:04.000000000', 'message': 'Retry dhcp_release on failures

Sometimes calls to dhcp_release(6) do not result in removal
of a lease from the leases file, for example, when the release
packet is not received by dnsmasq.  Trying more than once is
recommended in this case.

Instead of blindly trying some number of times, we monitor
the lease file contents, and retry the dhcp_release(6) call
when an entry still remains.  This is possible since
dhcp_release(6) is being run from the DHCP server itself.
We try three times and wait 0.3 seconds between tries.

We also now check for any stale leases in the leases file
that are unknown to neutron, also trying to remove them.

Change-Id: Ic1864f7efbc94db1369ac7f3e2879fda86f95a11
Closes-bug: #1764481
(cherry picked from commit fab032b426e1fa89dc473c61cbf15377fe4aaff3)
'}]
commit_message:
Retry dhcp_release on failures

Sometimes calls to dhcp_release(6) do not result in removal
of a lease from the leases file, for example, when the release
packet is not received by dnsmasq.  Trying more than once is
recommended in this case.

Instead of blindly trying some number of times, we monitor
the lease file contents, and retry the dhcp_release(6) call
when an entry still remains.  This is possible since
dhcp_release(6) is being run from the DHCP server itself.
We try three times and wait 0.3 seconds between tries.

We also now check for any stale leases in the leases file
that are unknown to neutron, also trying to remove them.

Change-Id: Ic1864f7efbc94db1369ac7f3e2879fda86f95a11
Closes-bug: #1764481
(cherry picked from commit fab032b426e1fa89dc473c61cbf15377fe4aaff3)

commit_message:
Set console proxy configuration according to cells v2 setup

Change 969239029d4a13956747e6e0b850d6c6ab4035f0 completed the
conversion of console token authorization storage from the
nova-consoleauth service to the database backend. With this change,
console proxies need to be configured on a per cell basis instead
of globally.

There was a devstack change 6645cf7a26428f3af1e4739ac29c6a90b67f99dc
following it that re-enabled the novnc tempest tests, but the nova-next
job that runs the console proxies with TLS is *not* part of the normal
set of jobs that run on devstack changes (it's in the experimental
queue), so it was able to merge without the nova-next job passing.

This configures the nova console proxies in the per cell configuration
file if cells v2 is configured for multiple cells in order to pass the
nova-next job.

Closes-Bug: #1769286

Change-Id: Ic4fff4c59eda43dd1bc6e7b645b513b46b57c235

[{'created': '2018-03-10 21:49:35.000000000', 'message': "Trim whitespace in Neutron configuration file for LBaaS

If neutron_lbaasv2 is set to true, the if statement is evaluated
and an extra 2 spaces are added.  This results in two spaces being
added before the '# General, applies to all host groups' which
results in config_template being unable to parse the file in
addition to Neutron failing to parse the configuration as well.

Change-Id: I4e04e1b9e6219d60c703240d01d6bf8a1a32ccda
"}]
commit_message:
Trim whitespace in Neutron configuration file for LBaaS

If neutron_lbaasv2 is set to true, the if statement is evaluated
and an extra 2 spaces are added.  This results in two spaces being
added before the '# General, applies to all host groups' which
results in config_template being unable to parse the file in
addition to Neutron failing to parse the configuration as well.

Change-Id: I4e04e1b9e6219d60c703240d01d6bf8a1a32ccda

commit_message:
Elasticsearch: Fix snapshot repo path on changing directory owner

The init container for changing permissions for the elasticsearch
pods was referencing the wrong path for the snapshots repository.
This changes the mount path to the correct directory path

Change-Id: I254d4baf20ed586b37f5ad645029f48ac8e46f4c

[{'created': '2018-01-18 00:50:15.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Define workflow interface for image prepare/upload

The interface consists of the following:
- A heat parameter ContainerImagePrepare which contains instructions
  for generating the image parameters and (optionally) uploading images
  to a registry
- Environment default-registry.yaml which will trigger pulling images
  from the default registry
- Environment undercloud-registry.yaml which will trigger uploading
  images to the undercloud registry and pulling from that

For other registries or non-typical image options the deployer can
create their own environment which fully defines their required
ContainerImagePrepare values.

To use this interface, workflows will need to modified to do the
following:
- on plan creation/import/update, modify the plan version of
  default-registry.yaml and undercloud-registry.yaml to contain current
  defaults and the discovered undercloud registry host
- on plan creation/import/update generate the image parameters environment
  file based on values in ContainerImagePrepare
- on overcloud deploy, upload images if push_destination is defined

Change-Id: I1b485ff9491fe2b1cf850116f9133de8d05f3d40

commit_message:
WIP Define workflow interface for image prepare/upload

The interface consists of the following:
- A heat parameter ContainerImagePrepare which contains instructions
  for generating the image parameters and (optionally) uploading images
  to a registry
- Environment default-registry.yaml which will trigger pulling images
  from the default registry
- Environment undercloud-registry.yaml which will trigger uploading
  images to the undercloud registry and pulling from that

For other registries or non-typical image options the deployer can
create their own environment which fully defines their required
ContainerImagePrepare values.

To use this interface, workflows will need to modified to do the
following:
- on plan creation/import/update, modify the plan version of
  default-registry.yaml and undercloud-registry.yaml to contain current
  defaults and the discovered undercloud registry host
- on plan creation/import/update generate the image parameters environment
  file based on values in ContainerImagePrepare
- on overcloud deploy, upload images if push_destination is defined

Change-Id: I1b485ff9491fe2b1cf850116f9133de8d05f3d40
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

commit_message:
Use extension fip-port-details from neutron-lib

The fip-port-details extension's API definition was added into
neutron-lib with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534882/
This patch consumes it by using the API definition.

It also bumps the requires to use neutron-lib 1.14.0

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I9a93c0aef247f6145f3a55a44d08844d74b44eff

commit_message:
remove common db alaises to db utils

A handful of the functions implemented in neutron.db._utils are exposed
in common_db_mixin as aliases. These are unneeded as they're already
defined elsewhere.

This patch removes the following aliases in common_db_mixin:
- safe_creation
- model_query_scope
- model_query
- resource_fields

It also renames the UT for common db mixin to
test__utils to reflect the fact that its testing functions
from the _utils db module.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I53cd533f107d950f163ad5b19b47097546a4691d

commit_message:
Add Grafana repository for arm64

Official ARM support as part of the release process of grafana is on
development [0].

For now, the closest official repositories are the ones from fg2it
repository, which is also part of the developers working on the support,
so we are adding it to the sources for now until the official support is
done.

[0] https://github.com/grafana/grafana-docker/issues/117

Bug: #1768585

Signed-off-by: Jorge Niedbalski <jorge.niedbalski@linaro.org>

Change-Id: Iba004f99c0ac92cb660e405c5ac9c61dc7fa81e2
(cherry picked from commit bfa0fe778f2d4305f3ba9017db162af835335fdc)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 21:18:27.000000000', 'message': "Handle @safe_connect returns None side effect in _ensure_resource_provider

Change I0c4ca6a81f213277fe7219cb905a805712f81e36 added more error
handling to the _ensure_resource_provider flow but didn't account
for @safe_connect returning None when calling _create_resource_provider
in the case that nova-compute is started before placement is running.
If that happens, we fail with a TypeError during the nova-compute
startup because we put None in the resource provider cache and then
later blindly try to use it because the compute node resource provider
uuid is in the cache, but mapped to None.

This adds the None check back in _ensure_resource_provider and if
None is returned from _create_resource_provider we raise the same
exception that _create_resource_provider would raise if it couldn't
create the provider.

Change-Id: If9e1581db9c1ae14340b787d03c815d243d5a50c
Closes-Bug: #1767139
(cherry picked from commit 80a001989351d3d427c204c8c06cfacc964f2a35)
(cherry picked from commit c1ca4a1498854076d0beb73e3f059fcb1d23309a)
"}, {'created': '2018-05-03 23:46:08.000000000', 'message': "Handle @safe_connect returns None side effect in _ensure_resource_provider

Change I0c4ca6a81f213277fe7219cb905a805712f81e36 added more error
handling to the _ensure_resource_provider flow but didn't account
for @safe_connect returning None when calling _create_resource_provider
in the case that nova-compute is started before placement is running.
If that happens, we fail with a TypeError during the nova-compute
startup because we put None in the resource provider cache and then
later blindly try to use it because the compute node resource provider
uuid is in the cache, but mapped to None.

This adds the None check back in _ensure_resource_provider and if
None is returned from _create_resource_provider we raise the same
exception that _create_resource_provider would raise if it couldn't
create the provider.

Conflicts:

nova/scheduler/client/report.py: entire method conflicted as
provider_tree changes have not been backported.

nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py - didn't conflict but
referenced non-existant methods. Re-implemented based on
test_ensure_resource_provider_create_fail changing mocked
create_resource_provider to return None instead of raising an exception.

Change-Id: If9e1581db9c1ae14340b787d03c815d243d5a50c
Closes-Bug: #1767139
(cherry picked from commit 80a001989351d3d427c204c8c06cfacc964f2a35)
(cherry picked from commit f95a10b26eb67796a4de32c32afe85c8f6a77048)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle @safe_connect returns None side effect in _ensure_resource_provider

Change I0c4ca6a81f213277fe7219cb905a805712f81e36 added more error
handling to the _ensure_resource_provider flow but didn't account
for @safe_connect returning None when calling _create_resource_provider
in the case that nova-compute is started before placement is running.
If that happens, we fail with a TypeError during the nova-compute
startup because we put None in the resource provider cache and then
later blindly try to use it because the compute node resource provider
uuid is in the cache, but mapped to None.

This adds the None check back in _ensure_resource_provider and if
None is returned from _create_resource_provider we raise the same
exception that _create_resource_provider would raise if it couldn't
create the provider.

Conflicts:

nova/scheduler/client/report.py: entire method conflicted as
provider_tree changes have not been backported.

nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py - didn't conflict but
referenced non-existant methods. Re-implemented based on
test_ensure_resource_provider_create_fail changing mocked
create_resource_provider to return None instead of raising an exception.

Change-Id: If9e1581db9c1ae14340b787d03c815d243d5a50c
Closes-Bug: #1767139
(cherry picked from commit 80a001989351d3d427c204c8c06cfacc964f2a35)
(cherry picked from commit f95a10b26eb67796a4de32c32afe85c8f6a77048)

commit_message:
Remove retired tripleo-incubator from PROJECTS list

tripleo-incubator has been retired so we don't cache it on our images
but if it is in the PROJECTS list we will attempt to rsync it. Just
remove it as it is no longer used.

Change-Id: I3ad57d247a02881ba8a6757f2a058d03884eaf35

commit_message:
Adding Ambari missing versions

With the new validation system, image versions on get_image_arguments()
has to contain all available versions in order to allow cluster creation
and validation with them all.

Story: #2001888
Change-Id: I88c2a553512a797099a4b2fbd9e9d204475e755b
(cherry picked from commit d9c9fe4c67f93e77ce26963618f29665222f87ae)

commit_message:
Add new config option and setup for token keys

This change adds new configuration options under the `token`
section for key_repository and max_active_keys. These settings
are meant to replace the settings of the same name under the
`fernet_tokens` catagory, which this change also deprecates.

Depends-on: I180209bbb11ee56ff5a950df4c5cbe5759c349ac
Change-Id: I466db3a47261cbec64091684caa903747b70cc3a

commit_message:
Move fernet doctor checks into tokens checks

This change moves the doctor checks for the fernet token key
repository under the token checks. This is to allow for more
generic checking when using token providers that use similar
key rotation functionality.

Change-Id: I356b9f90d8c2e07f65e788f93fc115d0d408df11

commit_message:
remove Allocation.project_id & Allocation.user_id

Removes the project_id and user_id fields from the Allocation object
definition. These values are now found in the Consumer object that is
embedded in the Allocation object which is now non-nullable.

Modifies the serialization in the allocation handler to look for a the
missing sentinel in Allocation.consumer.project.external_id field when
outputting the project_id and user_id JSON output (when appropriate for
the microversion)

Change-Id: If17ec7a16ef56f64a96097e6b1d2040e651352a8
blueprint: add-consumer-generation

commit_message:
remove "requirements" mode from propose_update.sh

We do not automatically propose updates to projects' requirements, so
we don't need this branch of logic any more.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555402/
Change-Id: I511ead56a6a6efecde25ce6b118256aa0560023a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 12:21:37.000000000', 'message': 'Improve ChunkedBackupDriver hashlib calls

Currently we have 2 hashlib calls withing the ChunkedBackupDriver, one
to calculate the MD5 of the chunk and another to calculate the SHA256 of
the blocks within each chunk.

This patch improve interactions between cinder and the hashlib library
method calls by making sure MD5 and SHA256 related calls are execute in
a native thread to improve context switching responsiveness within
eventlet.

The MD5 of a 1GB chunk could take around 4 seconds, so the overhead of
creating a native thread is acceptable, and for the SHA256 instead of
creating a thread for each call we create a single thread to do the
calculations of all the blocks, thus making it cost effective.

Current code slices the data into blocks, which means that the data is being
copied, but this has now been switched to a memoryview object to take advantage
of the buffer protocol so copying of data is no longer necesary.

Change-Id: Ifb65b8008f30bc9cc4b6cd9b867a726ec4ed4707
(cherry picked from commit 671b02b504a45953cf225a210c361729d480dd66)
Conflicts:
	cinder/backup/chunkeddriver.py
'}]
commit_message:
Improve ChunkedBackupDriver hashlib calls

Currently we have 2 hashlib calls withing the ChunkedBackupDriver, one
to calculate the MD5 of the chunk and another to calculate the SHA256 of
the blocks within each chunk.

This patch improve interactions between cinder and the hashlib library
method calls by making sure MD5 and SHA256 related calls are execute in
a native thread to improve context switching responsiveness within
eventlet.

The MD5 of a 1GB chunk could take around 4 seconds, so the overhead of
creating a native thread is acceptable, and for the SHA256 instead of
creating a thread for each call we create a single thread to do the
calculations of all the blocks, thus making it cost effective.

Current code slices the data into blocks, which means that the data is being
copied, but this has now been switched to a memoryview object to take advantage
of the buffer protocol so copying of data is no longer necesary.

Change-Id: Ifb65b8008f30bc9cc4b6cd9b867a726ec4ed4707
(cherry picked from commit 671b02b504a45953cf225a210c361729d480dd66)
Conflicts:
	cinder/backup/chunkeddriver.py

wrong. When setting multiple properties in single command, additional

Closes-bug: #1768427

commit_message:
[VNX] Fix property set in configuration doc

The syntax of setting multiple properties in VNX configuration doc was
wrong. When setting multiple properties in single command, additional
`--property` should be added.

Change-Id: I1ccff3b55f16f0c30f3c1ca73b522d390dc42c97
Closes-bug: #1768427

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 22:53:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix os-detach attachment_id schema

The os-detach attachment_id schema is more restrictive
in a non-backwards compatible way in that it was previously
possible to do:

POST /volume/v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action
{
    "os-detach": {
        "attachment_id": null
    }
}

With the schema change I39ede009d5e909a076860df7305865286caa5352
attachment_id is still optional but if specified, it must be
a non-null UUID string, which is not backward compatible and
can break old client code.

This change makes the attachment_id parameter value optional
again and also fixes the "uuid_allow_null" parameter type
definition which previously allowed non-uuid format strings.

Change-Id: Ifb97457a03795b84287922a5389fab91c402380f
Closes-Bug: #1768650
'}]
commit_message:
Fix os-detach attachment_id schema

The os-detach attachment_id schema is more restrictive
in a non-backwards compatible way in that it was previously
possible to do:

POST /volume/v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action
{
    "os-detach": {
        "attachment_id": null
    }
}

With the schema change I39ede009d5e909a076860df7305865286caa5352
attachment_id is still optional but if specified, it must be
a non-null UUID string, which is not backward compatible and
can break old client code.

This change makes the attachment_id parameter value optional
again and also fixes the "uuid_allow_null" parameter type
definition which previously allowed non-uuid format strings.

Change-Id: Ifb97457a03795b84287922a5389fab91c402380f
Closes-Bug: #1768650

commit_message:
Fix deprecations in the ironic modules

* auth_uri was replaced by www_authenticate_uri
* conductor::api_url is redundant, can be fetched from keystone
* glance_api_servers is redundant, can be fetched from keystone

Change-Id: I654f312754e169c54f3e7072160006b8d3112265

commit_message:
undercloud: do not hardcode eth1 for public interface

Instead, rely on local_interface parameter from undercloud.conf like it
was with instack-undercloud.

Depends-On: I94de786a4e2d6bfbc66e08f32ea65c217ea35268
Change-Id: Id46256b66aa43c38a6a6501d2f26dfb85009b1ef

commit_message:
Undercloud upgrades will use upgrade_tasks

Instead of using host_prep_tasks (which are part of deployment tasks),
we'll use the upgrade tasks that are now well known and tested in
previous releases, when the we containerized the overcloud.

Depends-On: Id25e6280b4b4f060d5e3f78a50ff83aaca9e6b1a
Change-Id: Ic199c7d431e155e2d37996acd0d7b924d14af2b7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 10:39:31.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure config-download mappings are unset on ceph-upgrade

Purpose is to ensure that any mapping previously used to enable
config-download is reset to perform a regular Heat stack update on
ceph-upgrade. We may need to do "update/upgrade/ffwd -> ceph ->
converge" instead of the previously assumed "update/upgrade/ffwd ->
converge -> ceph".

This also removes the no-op of DeploymentSteps -- we need them enabled
during Ceph upgrade as we need firewall rules applied.

Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1767318
Related-Bug: #1767317
Change-Id: I52312ffcd438c354872ab3c74138b47ae71aab4b

commit_message:
Ensure config-download mappings are unset on ceph-upgrade

Purpose is to ensure that any mapping previously used to enable
config-download is reset to perform a regular Heat stack update on
ceph-upgrade. We may need to do "update/upgrade/ffwd -> ceph ->
converge" instead of the previously assumed "update/upgrade/ffwd ->
converge -> ceph".

This also removes the no-op of DeploymentSteps -- we need them enabled
during Ceph upgrade as we need firewall rules applied.

Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1767318
Related-Bug: #1767317
Change-Id: I52312ffcd438c354872ab3c74138b47ae71aab4b
(cherry picked from commit fc9d9ee49328b4745a6de02b0051d56f873d03cf)

Remove static config option table for Infinidat

Switch to using dynamic generation using config-table.

Change-Id: I02eb65683ecc3ee00ae0af994c410ff83ce94c9c

commit_message:
QNAP: driver fails to detach while uploading volume to image

After upload volume to image, driver fails to detach iscsi
device. We fixed the passed parameters in detach function.

Change-Id: I5d63a4850f61a838ff1d4a5f1b6612f863b2bfd1
Closes-Bug: #1766768

commit_message:
Remove stale pip-missing-reqs tox test

pip_missing_reqs tool is no longer maintained and has broken with
release 10 of pip

Refer to:
 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/130027.html

Change-Id: Ie3482611889cb9194c123fdcfd1a12d56e068244

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-07 12:56:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the detection of scala version (now https)

The www.scala-lang.org switched to https and the curl call did not
account for this scenario, so it failed.
Switch the address to https and as extra measure add also the -L
argument, which forces curl to follow the redirects.

Switch also the download URL to https.

Story: 2001964
Task: 15088
Change-Id: I9d28c2ad56292998a6b7aaea421b98e136fbf6e1
(cherry picked from commit 9abcec3c828710df16b20a886b085ab40e4fa45d)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the detection of scala version (now https)

The www.scala-lang.org switched to https and the curl call did not
account for this scenario, so it failed.
Switch the address to https and as extra measure add also the -L
argument, which forces curl to follow the redirects.

Switch also the download URL to https.

Story: 2001964
Task: 15088
Change-Id: I9d28c2ad56292998a6b7aaea421b98e136fbf6e1
(cherry picked from commit 9abcec3c828710df16b20a886b085ab40e4fa45d)

pypy is not checked at gate

We also don't use python 3.4.

commit_message:
Deprecate TypeAffinityFilter

This deprecates the TypeAffinityFilter. This filter, which
is really an anti-affinity filter for flavors, attempts to
ensure that no two flavors show up on the same host. However,
to do this it relies on the flavors.id primary key, which is
subject to "change" if/when the admin deletes and recreates a
flavor (this is how Horizon allows you to 'edit' a flavor).
When you do that, you have a new flavor with a new id primary
key and the filter will not know the difference. So you could
really end up with more than one m1.large instance on the
same host, which defeats the purpose of the filter.

This filter is also problematic for
blueprint put-host-manager-instance-info-on-a-diet because in
that blueprint we want to stop sending full instance objects
over RPC from all compute services to the scheduler just to
track affinity and anti-affinity. All we really need for the
ServerGroupAffinityFilter and ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter
is the list of instance uuids on a host, not the full object.
If we can get rid of TypeAffinityFilter, we can change the
compute<>scheduler RPC calls to just pass the list of instance
uuids for update_instance_info rather than sending an InstanceList.

Change-Id: I660e0316b11afcad65c0fe7bd167ddcec9239a8b

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: Iad37ecdbdb022f120e9b737b6613dea49ab23b17

commit_message:
Migrate to stestr

This patch updates tox.ini to directly call stestr instead of ostestr
[1]. ostestr is no longer installed by default by infra.

For more info on stestr, please refer to [2].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-September/122135.html
[2] http://stestr.readthedocs.io/en/latest/MANUAL.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550282/
Change-Id: Ie6a275170ec6faf0db3976410660f52078710a54
(cherry picked from commit 7f3506b2956c4f6edc24703ea8099ce783715897)

commit_message:
doc: add note about xenapi aggregate upcall being resolved

Change I2c492c46e85c1df96aa7fdc12cdee0b1c7ba775e removed the
need to the host aggregate up-call when doing non-block
live migration in the xenapi driver. This change adds a note
in the cells v2 layout docs saying the upcall is resolved.

Related to blueprint live-migration-in-xapi-pool

Change-Id: I7fe6ed428c77a0f719afb957d74e517f1ab9a991

commit_message:
Replace Chinese punctuation with English punctuation

Curly quotes(Chinese punctuation) usually input from Chinese input method.
When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

[{'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-05-07 18:08:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-05-07 18:09:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-05-07 18:10:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-05-07 19:54:31.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

The requirement for sleep was because the _deny_access method wasn't waiting for the rule to be deleted: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544519/15/manila_tempest_tests/tests/scenario/manager_share.py@170 

If a waiter is added to that method to wait for the share's access_rules_status to be 'active', this sleep is unnecessary."}]

commit_message:
add an option to include +1 votes in stats

We still ignore +1 votes by default, but for some specific queries it
can be useful to include them so provide an option to do that.

Change-Id: If884da27382f7bb59e6e889b52ad1fc34aca5c0f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add server groups and server group members quota management in Horizon

Currently we can't set server groups and server group members quotas
in Horizon, they are still the back end definition of default.
In some cases, it will failed to create an instance when server group
members quota is insufficient. Therefore, it is necessary to specify
the quota of the server groups and server group members when creating
and editing the project. This patch allows the user to modify the
default values for the server groups and the server group members
quota.

Change-Id: Ifbd51bec3e775d8fecbf110da37309a443a3d1ba
Closes-Bug:#1732429

commit_message:
Make babel_extract_angular work with python 3

Also run pep8 env with python3 as pep8/flake8 python 3 is
generally more strict.

Change-Id: Id4669ca1f929826f07cfe2928092d0e7255fda6f
Closes-Bug: #1762992

commit_message:
Revert CentOS image size bump

The image size for CentOS was bumped from 2G to 3G in this patch:
I724f5064309d07fe05f86fcf2c7a488d9319e54c

It seems like I was wrong about this requirement -- this may have been
due to my test environment installing a custom HAProxy version, and
without that the standard 2G size seems to be fine.

Change-Id: Idf44c128e750f0783b08b08f3508724bacd270e5

[{'created': '2018-05-01 15:49:30.000000000', 'message': 'add tripleo update job as voting

    add an update non-voting job to mimimal check

    Goal: in two diff commits.
    Use the update job to gate:
    - tripleo-quickstart
    - tripleo-quickstart-extras
    - tripleo-upgrade

    Use the update job to check non-voting
    - tripleo-$other repos

    At the moment tripleo-upgrade is ungated.
    To properly protect against changes in tripleo
    repos it is useful to run the update job as
    non-voting to help detect if a tripleo change
    caused the update job to fail.

Change-Id: Ic4d898e01ae2a72117283ecec38cec5f22eae28b
'}]
commit_message:
add tripleo update job as voting

    add an update non-voting job to mimimal check

    Goal: in two diff commits.
    Use the update job to gate:
    - tripleo-quickstart
    - tripleo-quickstart-extras
    - tripleo-upgrade

    Use the update job to check non-voting
    - tripleo-$other repos

    At the moment tripleo-upgrade is ungated.
    To properly protect against changes in tripleo
    repos it is useful to run the update job as
    non-voting to help detect if a tripleo change
    caused the update job to fail.

Change-Id: Ic4d898e01ae2a72117283ecec38cec5f22eae28b

commit_message:
Add/move Zuul repos to a zuul project group in SB

Move Zuul-team-specific projects from the openstack-ci group on
storyboard.openstack.org to the zuul group: nodepool, zuul,
zuul-base-jobs, zuul-sphinx, zuul-website, and zuul-website-media.

Keep these cross-over projects in the openstack-ci group but also
add them to the zuul group: puppet-zuul, zone-zuul-ci.org (Infra
repos of interest to the Zuul team), and zuul-jobs (Zuul repo of
interest to the Infra team).

Change-Id: I8aeba6ec8cb5e4868cf66ee13f78e315f7b253ea

commit_message:
Fix bug as BDM failed when booting from volume

When booting an instance from volume, volume will be reserved
before scheduler(volume status would be set as 'attaching'),
but when failed at block-device-mapping, volume will be in
'attaching' status and would not be unreserved even when error
instance deleted.

So call unreserve_volume method when clear_volumes when
bdm.volume_id find.

Change-Id: I4bb6e58ede309ff9c63786a8044e9131551fe238
Closes-Bug: #1734066

commit_message:
[TrivialFix] Use tempest.config instead of oslo_config.cfg

This is to use tempest.config in only 2 test files that use
oslo_config.cfg. This is done for consistency with all other
test files and because Tempest's config loads in plugin config
options too so it is better to use it.

Change-Id: Ib360382c4543544d379a51aadcd3d419ef74bcfb

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 18:24:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes grafana source repository for arm64.

Official ARM support as part of the release
process of grafana is on development [0].

For now, the closest official repositories are the ones
from fg2it repository, which is also part of the
developers working on the support, so we are adding
it to the sources for now until the official support
is done.

This change also splits the source files by architecture
adding a new sources.list.debian.aarch64 file.

[0] https://github.com/grafana/grafana-docker/issues/117

Bug: #1768585
Change-Id: Iba004f99c0ac92cb660e405c5ac9c61dc7fa81e2
Signed-off-by: Jorge Niedbalski <jorge.niedbalski@linaro.org>

commit_message:
Add Grafana repository for arm64

Official ARM support as part of the release process of grafana is on
development [0].

For now, the closest official repositories are the ones from fg2it
repository, which is also part of the developers working on the support,
so we are adding it to the sources for now until the official support is
done.

[0] https://github.com/grafana/grafana-docker/issues/117

Bug: #1768585

Signed-off-by: Jorge Niedbalski <jorge.niedbalski@linaro.org>

Change-Id: Iba004f99c0ac92cb660e405c5ac9c61dc7fa81e2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 11:16:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: I75fa19faacaa42173b90809990b7ebe19ba66d93
'}]
commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: I75fa19faacaa42173b90809990b7ebe19ba66d93

commit_message:
Configure NeutronPublicInterface with local_interface

... for parity with instack-undercloud, so we don't hardcode eth1
anymore in THT.

Change-Id: I94de786a4e2d6bfbc66e08f32ea65c217ea35268

commit_message:
Switch undercloud to consume upgrade_tasks from THT

This patch enables the containerized undercloud to run
'openstack tripleo deploy --upgrade' so we can consume Ansible
upgrade_tasks from THT and reduce the code overlap with upgrade logic
from undercloud and overcloud.

Change-Id: Id25e6280b4b4f060d5e3f78a50ff83aaca9e6b1a

'}, {'created': '2018-04-20 07:01:55.000000000', 'message': "Add Congress scenario as check job

This fixes the congress job, which requires
glance for tempest testing, and enables
its automatic testing.

Congress isn't in-line with other projects
requirements (requesting conflicting versions
of hacking for example), but all the tempest
plugins are installed in the same virtualenv.

The Depends-on patch allow the tempest role to skip
the installation of test-requirements conditionally.
We therefore flip that switch for the congress
test-requirements.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554611
Change-Id: Idf774ead76e9f45e510276afc09c402f111b8fd9
"}, {'created': '2018-04-20 09:22:13.000000000', 'message': 'Improve Congress scenario testing

Indeed congress needs a series of requirements, in
the test-requirements, that aren't built by the repo
server, because they aren't part of other deliverables.
This tempest patchset prevent the "hacking" package to break
the installation of congress tempest plugin.
This patch set initially depended on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554611.
However, it has been merged and can left out of this change.

The addition of glance is required for the basic tempest tests
to pass through.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554611
Change-Id: Idf774ead76e9f45e510276afc09c402f111b8fd9

commit_message:
Improve Congress scenario testing

- Activate congress tempest based on inventory.
- Glance is also required for the overall scenario to pass
- SHA bump to update the latest "hacking" requirements
- The Depends-on patch allow the tempest role to skip
  the installation of test-requirements conditionally.
  We therefore flip that switch for the congress
  test-requirements.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554611
Change-Id: Idf774ead76e9f45e510276afc09c402f111b8fd9

commit_message:
Migration to Storyboard

Sahara projects migrated to storyboard.openstack.org.
Replace the references to Launchpad, including the rename of
a documentation page focuse on launchpad (which would
probably require a redirect on the openstack.org site),
and clean up some old details about blueprints.
Fix the bug links in the openstackdocstheme configuration.

Change-Id: I30642356f1b1076a874f14fc43fad234fa9a098d
(cherry picked from commit 3734ef7f5ebd37a557970d94d87c2ed1aaf3e8d1)

Adding a new command:
$ openstack tripleo upgrade

This new command will run underneath:
$ openstack tripleo deploy --upgrade

The only difference when running this command is that we'll execute
upgrade tasks generated by config-download before the deployment tasks.

It'll be used by the containerized undercloud to upgrade by re-using the
upgrade tasks in THT, that were designed for the overcloud. We'll try to
re-use them so we avoid code duplication.

commit_message:
Implement 'openstack tripleo upgrade'

Adding a new command:
$ openstack tripleo upgrade

This new command will run underneath:
$ openstack tripleo deploy --upgrade

The only difference when running this command is that we'll execute
upgrade tasks generated by config-download before the deployment tasks.

It'll be used by the containerized undercloud to upgrade by re-using the
upgrade tasks in THT, that were designed for the overcloud. We'll try to
re-use them so we avoid code duplication.

Change-Id: Ic932b3b308c83bc72fff4c0ef8ce94e878f33997

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: Iefdeebddbb12a9d2acba721afd7f1df9c51dffe6

commit_message:
SQUASH: Add a helper method to populate ContainerBroker cached attributes

The ContainerBroker account, container and storage_policy_index
attributes are lazy loaded from the database and then cached as
instance attributes. This patch replaces several places where the
values are conditionally loaded with a call to a helper method.

Change-Id: I05e659983a926ab2c1cc219762edc1f3a990b61a

subject: SQUASH: Fix deadlock post cleave
messages: [{'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-05-04 08:32:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-05-04 13:35:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-05-07 16:24:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nmerged to https://review.openstack.org/565744'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-04 08:32:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix deadlock post cleave

The replicator does a reclaim before it does replication, when the
cleave populates a shard db it might have some rows to reclaim.  During
the call stack of shard_broker.reclaim we can get a dead lock while
trying to call get_info to service the path property before having
called commit to finish the DELETE in reclaim.

When we hit the deadlock the transaction remains uncommited and we make
no progress.

Change-Id: I0c66c4ad223a047b33406281b224cb285ca498de
'}, {'created': '2018-05-04 13:35:50.000000000', 'message': 'SQUASH: Fix deadlock post cleave

The replicator does a reclaim before it does replication, when the
cleave populates a shard db it might have some rows to reclaim.  During
the call stack of shard_broker.reclaim we can get a dead lock while
trying to call get_info to service the path property before having
called commit to finish the DELETE in reclaim.

When we hit the deadlock the transaction remains uncommited and we make
no progress.

Change-Id: I0c66c4ad223a047b33406281b224cb285ca498de
'}]
commit_message:
SQUASH: Fix deadlock post cleave

The replicator does a reclaim before it does replication, when the
cleave populates a shard db it might have some rows to reclaim.  During
the call stack of shard_broker.reclaim we can get a dead lock while
trying to call get_info to service the path property before having
called commit to finish the DELETE in reclaim.

When we hit the deadlock the transaction remains uncommited and we make
no progress.

Change-Id: I0c66c4ad223a047b33406281b224cb285ca498de

subject: SQUASH: Copy sharding source sync points to cleaved shard dbs
messages: [{'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-05-04 12:47:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-05-04 18:07:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-05-07 16:23:50.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nmerged into https://review.openstack.org/565748'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-04 12:47:53.000000000', 'message': 'SQUASH: Copy sharding source sync points to cleaved shard dbs

The first replica of a sharding db to create a shard db replicates the
shard db to all of its primary nodes.  If another replica of the
source db happens to be on one of the shard db primary nodes and
subsequently cleaves to the shard it will merge its object records
into an existing shard db.

Before, the second sharding replica would attempt to merge *all* of
its rows for the shard range to the existng shard db, because it had
no sync point in that shard db.  Now, the second replica may find a
sync point for itself in the shard db and only need to merge rows
after that sync point.

Sync points may now propagate as per this example for a root container
R sharding to a shard S:

R(id1) with max_row=N replicates to R(id2)
R(id2) stores incoming sync {id1: N}
R(id2) with max_row M shards to S(id3)
R(id2) stores sync points {id1: N, id2: M} in shard S(id3)
S(id3) is replicated to its promary nodes
R(id1) shards to an existing replica of S
R(id1) finds sync point {id1: N} in S
R(id1) only cleaves from row N, since all rows up to N were in R(id2)
       when it cleaved to S(id3)

Change-Id: I075e4d903c3d5a65dbb557fea78d47bca1f035f0
'}, {'created': '2018-05-04 18:07:16.000000000', 'message': 'SQUASH: Copy sharding source sync points to cleaved shard dbs

The first replica of a sharding db to create a shard db replicates the
shard db to all of its primary nodes.  If another replica of the
source db happens to be on one of the shard db primary nodes and
subsequently cleaves to the shard it will merge its object records
into an existing shard db.

Before, the second sharding replica would attempt to merge *all* of
its rows for the shard range to the existng shard db, because it had
no sync point in that shard db.  Now, the second replica may find a
sync point for itself in the shard db and only need to merge rows
after that sync point.

Sync points may now propagate as per this example for a root container
R sharding to a shard S:

R(id1) with max_row=N replicates to R(id2)
R(id2) stores incoming sync {id1: N}
R(id2) with max_row M shards to S(id3)
R(id2) stores sync points {id1: N, id2: M} in shard S(id3)
S(id3) is replicated to its promary nodes
R(id1) shards to an existing replica of S
R(id1) finds sync point {id1: N} in S
R(id1) only cleaves from row N, since all rows up to N were in R(id2)
       when it cleaved to S(id3)

Change-Id: I075e4d903c3d5a65dbb557fea78d47bca1f035f0
'}]
commit_message:
SQUASH: Copy sharding source sync points to cleaved shard dbs

The first replica of a sharding db to create a shard db replicates the
shard db to all of its primary nodes.  If another replica of the
source db happens to be on one of the shard db primary nodes and
subsequently cleaves to the shard it will merge its object records
into an existing shard db.

Before, the second sharding replica would attempt to merge *all* of
its rows for the shard range to the existng shard db, because it had
no sync point in that shard db.  Now, the second replica may find a
sync point for itself in the shard db and only need to merge rows
after that sync point.

Sync points may now propagate as per this example for a root container
R sharding to a shard S:

R(id1) with max_row=N replicates to R(id2)
R(id2) stores incoming sync {id1: N}
R(id2) with max_row M shards to S(id3)
R(id2) stores sync points {id1: N, id2: M} in shard S(id3)
S(id3) is replicated to its promary nodes
R(id1) shards to an existing replica of S
R(id1) finds sync point {id1: N} in S
R(id1) only cleaves from row N, since all rows up to N were in R(id2)
       when it cleaved to S(id3)

Change-Id: I075e4d903c3d5a65dbb557fea78d47bca1f035f0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-04 07:49:49.000000000', 'message': "Correct field filtering for member/l7rule/amphora

The exposed definition was incorrect due to a copy/paste error during
the original creation of these controllers, causing the field filter
list to be read as a single value. A side-effect of this was that the
filtering code still worked, but did an 'in' operation on one string
instead of a list.

This caused two bugs:
1) Multiple field filters were ignored, and only the first would be
returned.
2) The field matching would match inside of the field names, so
filtering for `id` would match `id`, `project_id`, etc. and return
extra fields.

Change-Id: Ibb509c1e487876b957ad02cd66cebebc178bef4d
Backport-Candidate: Queens Pike
"}]
commit_message:
Correct field filtering for member/l7rule/amphora

The exposed definition was incorrect due to a copy/paste error during
the original creation of these controllers, causing the field filter
list to be read as a single value. A side-effect of this was that the
filtering code still worked, but did an 'in' operation on one string
instead of a list.

This caused two bugs:
1) Multiple field filters were ignored, and only the first would be
returned.
2) The field matching would match inside of the field names, so
filtering for `id` would match `id`, `project_id`, etc. and return
extra fields.

Change-Id: Ibb509c1e487876b957ad02cd66cebebc178bef4d
Backport-Candidate: Queens Pike

[{'created': '2018-05-01 16:57:30.000000000', 'message': 'Remove Bandit from Infrastructure Systems
